verses.latin: Locutus est autem Dominus ad Moysen in tabernaculo testimonii, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses inside the Tabernacle of Testimony, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Homo ex vobis qui obtulerit hostiam Domino, de pecoribus, id est, de bobus et ovibus offerens victimas,
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel and tell them: When any person among you offers a sacrifice to the Lord, you must offer it from your livestock—either from your cattle or from your sheep.

verses.latin: Si holocaustum fuerit ejus oblatio, et de armentis: masculum immaculatum offeret ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, ut placabile sit pro eo Domino.
verses.english: If his offering is a burnt offering from his herd of cattle, he must present a perfect male animal at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony. This is so his offering will be acceptable to the Lord, making atonement for him.

verses.latin: Ponétque manum super caput hostiae, et acceptabilis erit, atque in expiationem illius proficiens.
verses.english: He will lay his hand on the head of the animal offered for sacrifice, and this act will make it acceptable, thereby providing atonement for him.

verses.latin: Immolabitque vitulum coram Domino, et offerent filii Aaron sacerdotes sanguinem ejus, fundentes per altaris circuitum, quod est ante ostium tabernaculi.
verses.english: Then he must slaughter the young bull before the Lord. Aaron's sons, the priests, will offer its blood by sprinkling it all around the altar, which stands at the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Detractaque pelle hostiae, dissectam per membra divident.
verses.english: After skinning the animal offered for sacrifice, they will cut it into its individual pieces.

verses.latin: Et injicient ignem super altare, compositis prius lignis desuper:
verses.english: They will then place fire upon the altar, after arranging wood on it beforehand.

verses.latin: Et desuper, membra quae dissecta sunt, caput videlicet, et omnia quae adhærent jecori, ordinabunt.
verses.english: And on top of the wood and fire, they will arrange the cut pieces, including the head and all the internal fat that adheres to the liver.

verses.latin: Intestina vero et pedes lavabunt aqua: et sacerdos cremabit omnia super altare in holocaustum et suavem odorem Domino.
verses.english: However, the internal organs and the legs must be washed with water. Then the priest will burn all of it on the altar as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si de pecoribus oblatio fuerit holocausti, et de ovibus, sive de capris, masculum absque macula offeret:
verses.english: If the burnt offering is from the flock—either from the sheep or the goats—he must offer a perfect male animal without blemish.

verses.latin: Immolabitque ad latus altaris aquilonis coram Domino: sanguinem vero illius fundent filii Aaron per circuitum ejus.
verses.english: He will slaughter it on the north side of the altar, before the Lord. Aaron’s sons will then sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Divisumque per membra, caput, et omnia quae adhærent jecori, ponent super ligna, quae igni supposita sunt.
verses.english: After cutting it into pieces, they will arrange the head and all the internal fat adhering to the liver on top of the wood, which has been placed on the fire.

verses.latin: Intestina vero et pedes lavabunt aqua: et offeret sacerdos omnia, et cremabit super altare in holocaustum et suavem odorem Domino.
verses.english: However, the internal organs and the legs must be washed with water. Then the priest will offer all of it and burn it on the altar as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si de avibus holocausti oblatio fuerit Domino, de turturibus, aut pullis columbarum,
verses.english: If his burnt offering to the Lord is from birds—either turtledoves or young pigeons—

verses.latin: offeret illud sacerdos ad altare: et retorto ad collum capite, ac rupta confractione nucha, comburet super altare, trudens in pariete caput ejus.
verses.english: The priest will bring it to the altar. He will wring its neck to break it and then burn it on the altar, pressing its head against the side of the altar.

verses.latin: Quas expandens, auferet sordes absque igne: et projiciet juxta altare ad orientalem plagam, in loco ubi cineres jactari solent.
verses.english: He will open the bird and remove its crop and its contents, not burning them, and throw them beside the altar on the east side, in the place where the ashes are usually placed.

verses.latin: Concidetque alas, et non omnino separabit, et sic cremabit illud super altare, impositis desuper lignis, et igne: holocaustum est, et oblatio suavissimi odoris Domino.
verses.english: He will tear its wings, but not separate them entirely from the body, and then burn the bird on the altar, upon the wood and the fire. This is a burnt offering, an offering of a most pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Anima cum obtulerit oblationem sacrificii, simila erit ejus oblatio Domino.
verses.english: When a person presents a grain offering as a sacrifice, his offering to the Lord must be fine flour.

verses.latin: Fundetque super eam oleum, et ponet thus, atque deferet ad filios Aaron sacerdotes.
verses.english: He will pour olive oil on it and put frankincense on it, then bring it to Aaron’s sons, the priests.

verses.latin: Quorum cum acceperit sacerdos pugillum plenum in monumentum, cremabit illud super altare, et suavem odorem Domino.
verses.english: When the priest receives it, he will take a handful as a memorial portion and burn it on the altar; it is a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quod autem reliquum fuerit de sacrificio, habebit Aaron et filii ejus: Sancta sanctorum est de oblationibus Domini.
verses.english: Whatever remains of the grain offering will belong to Aaron and his sons. It is a most holy portion from the Lord’s offerings.

verses.latin: Cum offeres sacrificium coctum in clibano, de simila absque fermento panes coctos oleo, et lagana azyma uncta oleo.
verses.english: When you offer a grain offering baked in an oven, it must consist of unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.

verses.latin: Si de sartagine fuerit oblatio similæ, conspersa oleo, absque fermento,
verses.english: If your grain offering is prepared on a griddle, it must be unleavened fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.latin: in frusta concisa offeres, et fundes super eam oleum.
verses.english: You will break it into pieces and pour oil over it.

verses.latin: Si autem de craticula, similæ oblatio fuerit conspersa oleo,
verses.english: If your grain offering is prepared in a pan, it must be fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.latin: tollent sacerdotes in memoriam ejus partem, et cremabunt super altare, et suavem odorem Domino.
verses.english: The priests will take a portion of it as a memorial and burn it on the altar; it is a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quod autem reliquum fuerit, habebit Aaron cum filiis suis, sancta sanctorum de oblationibus Domini.
verses.english: Whatever remains will belong to Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the Lord’s offerings.

verses.latin: Si anima peccaverit per ignorantiam, et fecerit unum de his, quae Domini lege prohibentur, atque deliquerit:
verses.english: If a person sins unintentionally by doing something forbidden by the Lord's Law, and thus becomes guilty, even if they were unaware of the transgression at the time:

verses.latin: offeret de armento bovem immaculatum Domino pro peccato, et adducet illum ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii ad sacerdotem.
verses.english: He must offer a perfect young bull from the herd to the Lord as a sin offering, and he will bring it to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony, to the priest.

verses.latin: Ponétque manum super caput ejus, et immolabit illum coram Domino:
verses.english: He will lay his hand on the head of the young bull and slaughter it before the Lord.

verses.latin: fundetque de sanguine ejus sacerdos in altaris circuitu.
verses.english: The priest will then sprinkle some of its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Pinguédinem vero, quae operit intestina, et omnes adipem qui jecori est adjunctus, auferet,
verses.english: He will remove all the fat that covers the internal organs, and all the fat that is attached to the liver.

verses.latin: sicut auferri solet de victimis pacificorum, et cremabit super altare in odorem suavissimum Domino.
verses.english: Just as the fat is removed from peace offerings, he will remove it and burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et orabit pro eo sacerdos, et pro peccato illius: et dimittetur ei.
verses.english: The priest will pray for him, making intercession for his sin, and it will be forgiven him.

verses.latin: Quod si de grege capra fuerit ejus oblatio pro peccato, offeret immaculatam capram,
verses.english: If his sin offering is a goat from the flock, he must offer a perfect female goat.

verses.latin: ponétque manum super caput ejus, et immolabit illam in loco ubi solent occidi holocausti victimæ coram Domino:
verses.english: He will lay his hand on its head and slaughter it in the place where burnt offerings are usually killed, before the Lord.

verses.latin: fundetque sacerdos de sanguine illius per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: The priest will sprinkle some of its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Omnem quoque pinguédinem auferet, sicut auferri solet de pacificorum victimis, et cremabit super altare in odorem suavissimum Domino: orabitque pro eo, et dimittetur ei.
verses.english: He will remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from peace offerings, and burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. The priest will pray for him, and it will be forgiven him.

verses.latin: Si agnum obtulerit pro peccato, masculum immaculatum offeret:
verses.english: If he offers a lamb as his sin offering, he must offer a perfect male lamb.

verses.latin: ponétque manum super caput ejus, et immolabit illud in loco ubi solent holocausti occidi victimæ: fundetque sacerdos de sanguine illius per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: He will lay his hand on its head and slaughter it in the place where burnt offerings are usually killed. The priest will sprinkle some of its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Anima cum obtulerit oblationem sacrificii Domino, simila erit ejus oblatio.
verses.english: When a person offers a sacrificial offering to the Lord, that offering must be of fine flour — a grain offering.

verses.latin: Fundetque super eam oleum, et ponet thus, ac deferet ad filios Aaron sacerdotes:
verses.english: And the person must pour oil over the fine flour, and then put frankincense on it, and bring it to the sons of Aaron, who are the priests.

verses.latin: quorum unus tollet pugillum plenum similæ et olei, et totum thus, et adolebit memoriale super altare, incensum suavissimum Domino.
verses.english: One of the priests will take a handful of the fine flour and oil, along with all the frankincense, and burn it on the altar as a memorial portion. This offering is a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quod autem reliquum fuerit de sacrificio, erit Aaron et filiorum ejus, sanctum sanctorum de oblationibus Domini.
verses.english: But whatever remains from the offering will belong to Aaron and his sons. It is considered most holy, taken from the Lord’s offerings.

verses.latin: Cum autem obtuleris sacrificium coctum in clibano ex similæ, panes scilicet absque fermento conspersos oleo, et lagana azyma uncta oleo:
verses.english: When you offer a grain offering baked in an oven, it must be unleavened bread made of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers brushed with oil.

verses.latin: si de sartagine fuerit oblatio, similæ oleo conspersæ erit absque fermento:
verses.english: If your offering is prepared on a griddle, it must be of fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened.

verses.latin: quæ in buccellas concisa, superfundes oleum.
verses.english: After it is cut into pieces, you must pour oil over it.

verses.latin: Sin autem de craticula, similæ oleo conspergatur.
verses.english: If the offering is prepared on a baking pan, it must be of fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.latin: Hæc offeres Domino per manus sacerdotis, qui cum obtulerit illam, tradet sacerdoti alteri.
verses.english: You will bring these offerings to the Lord through the hands of a priest. When the first priest presents it, he will hand it over to another priest.

verses.latin: Qui cum tulerit de ea memoriale, adolebit super altare, incensum suavissimum Domino.
verses.english: This priest will then take a memorial portion from it and burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quodcumque autem reliquum est, erit Aaron et filiorum ejus, sanctum sanctorum de oblationibus Domini.
verses.english: Whatever remains from this offering will belong to Aaron and his sons. It is considered most holy, taken from the Lord’s offerings.

verses.latin: Omnis oblatio, quæ offertur Domino, absque fermento erit, nec quicquam mellis in sacrificio Domini ardebit.
verses.english: Every grain offering presented to the Lord must be made without leaven. You must not burn any honey in an offering made to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quidquid obtuleris ex novo, primitiarum Domino offeres, sed super altare non ascendet in odorem suavitatis.
verses.english: Whatever you offer as firstfruits to the Lord, you must bring as a new offering. But it will not be burned on the altar as a pleasing aroma.

verses.latin: Omne sacrificium tuum sale condies, nec auferes sal fœderis Dei tui de sacrificio tuo. In omni oblatione tua offeres sal.
verses.english: You must season every one of your offerings with salt. Do not omit the salt of the covenant of your God from your offering. You must offer salt with every single offering you make.

verses.latin: Si autem obtuleris Domino oblationem primitiarum frugum, de spicis tostas et confractas fruges offeres, ut initiamentum sacrificii tui.
verses.english: If you offer a grain offering of firstfruits of grain to the Lord, you must offer roasted heads of grain and crushed new grain as the beginning of your offering.

verses.latin: Super quod infundes oleum, et pones thus, quia sacrificium Domini est.
verses.english: Over this, you must pour oil and put frankincense, because it is an offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si autem oblatio ejus pacificorum fuerit, et voluerit offerre de bubus, sive masculum, sive feminam, immaculatum offeret coram Domino.
verses.english: If someone brings a peace offering—an offering made to establish communion with God or give thanks—and chooses to offer an animal from his cattle, whether it is a male or a female, he must present it to the Lord without any physical defect.

verses.latin: Et ponet manum suam super caput hostiae suae, quae immolabitur in foribus tabernaculi testimonii: detrahentque filii Aaron sacerdotes sanguinem, et fundent per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: And he shall place his hand upon the head of his sacrificial animal. This animal will then be slaughtered at the entrance of the tent of meeting. The sons of Aaron, who are priests, shall drain its blood and sprinkle it all around the altar.

verses.latin: Offeretque de hostia pacificorum incensum Domini, adipem qui operit vitalia, et totum arvinam quæ est juxa vitalia.
verses.english: From this peace offering, he shall then present as an offering by fire to the Lord the fat that covers the animal's internal organs, including all the fatty tissue surrounding these organs.

verses.latin: Et duos renunculos cum adipe quo teguntur ilia, et reticulum jecoris cum renunculis.
verses.english: He shall also offer the two kidneys, with the fat that is on them near the loins, and the fatty lobe that covers the liver, removing it together with the kidneys.

verses.latin: Et succendent ea filii Aaron super altare super holocaustum, quæ est super ligna igni supposita: incensum et oblationem Domini est.
verses.english: The sons of Aaron shall then burn these parts on the altar, placing them on top of the burnt offering that is already laid upon the wood and the fire. This is an offering by fire, a sweet aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si oblatio ejus de pecoribus est, et pacificorum hostia de ovibus immolat, sive masculum, sive feminam, immaculatum offeret.
verses.english: If his offering is from the flock—that is, if he offers a peace offering from the sheep, whether it is a male or a female—he must present it without blemish.

verses.latin: Si agnum obtulerit, juxta ritum supradictum.
verses.english: If he offers a lamb, he must follow the same procedures described above for cattle.

verses.latin: Ponetque manum suam super caput hostiae suae, quæ immolabitur in foribus tabernaculi testimonii: fundentque filii Aaron sanguinem ejus per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: He shall lay his hand upon the head of his sacrificial animal, which will then be slaughtered at the entrance of the tent of meeting. The sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Offeretque de pacificorum hostia incensum Domini, adipem et caudam totam Aegypti, adipe grossa renunculos tegente, et vitalia.
verses.english: From the peace offering, he shall then present as an offering by fire to the Lord its fat, including the entire fat tail, cut off close to the backbone. He shall also offer the fat that covers the internal organs.

verses.latin: Et duos renunculos cum adipe quo teguntur ilia, et reticulum jecoris cum renunculis.
verses.english: And the two kidneys, with the fat that is on them near the loins, and the fatty lobe that covers the liver, removing it together with the kidneys.

verses.latin: Et succendet ea sacerdos super altare: cibus ignis oblationis Domini est.
verses.english: The priest shall then burn these parts on the altar. This is the food of the offering by fire to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si de capris fuerit ejus oblatio, offerat eam immaculatam.
verses.english: If his offering is a goat, he must present it without blemish.

verses.latin: Ponetque manum suam super caput ejus, et immolabit in foribus tabernaculi testimonii: fundentque filii Aaron sanguinem ejus per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: He shall lay his hand upon its head, and it will then be slaughtered at the entrance of the tent of meeting. The sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.latin: Offeretque ex eo incensum Domini, adipem qui operit vitalia, et totum arvinam qua operit ilia.
verses.english: From it, he shall then present as an offering by fire to the Lord its fat, including the fat that covers the internal organs, and all the fatty tissue surrounding these organs.

verses.latin: Duosque renunculos cum adipe quo teguntur ilia, et reticulum jecoris cum renunculis.
verses.english: And the two kidneys, with the fat that is on them near the loins, and the fatty lobe that covers the liver, removing it together with the kidneys.

verses.latin: Et succendet ea sacerdos super altare, in cibum ignis, et in odorem suavissimum: omnis enim adeps Domini est.
verses.english: The priest shall then burn these parts on the altar as food for the offering by fire, for a pleasing aroma. For all the fat belongs to the Lord.

verses.latin: Lege perpetua in generationibus et omnibus habitaculis vestris: omne adipem et sanguinem non comedetis.
verses.english: This shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations and in all your dwelling places: you shall eat no fat and no blood.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël: Anima cum peccaverit per ignorantiam, et fecerit unum ex omnibus mandatis Domini quae prohibentur ne fiant, nec intellexerit:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel: If a person sins unintentionally, doing something that the Lord has forbidden in His commandments, and does not realize it at the time, then this is what they must do:

verses.latin: si sacerdos qui est unctus peccaverit, delinquens populum, offeret pro peccato suo vitulum immaculatum Domino.
verses.english: If the High Priest—the one who has been anointed—sins in a way that brings guilt upon the people, he must offer a young, unblemished bull to the Lord as a sacrifice for his own sin.

verses.latin: Adducet ergo vitulum ad portam tabernaculi testimonii coram Domino, ponetque manum suam super caput ejus, et immolabit eum coram Domino.
verses.english: He must bring the young bull to the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Testimony, before the Lord. He shall place his hand upon its head and slaughter it there before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et tollet de sanguine vituli, inferens illud in tabernaculum testimonii.
verses.english: Then he must take some of the bull's blood and carry it into the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

verses.latin: Tinguetque digitum in sanguine, et asperget ex eo septies contra velum sanctuarii.
verses.english: He shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of it seven times towards the veil of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Ponensque de eodem sanguine super cornua altaris thymiamatis gratissimi coram Domino, quod est in tabernaculo testimonii: reliquum autem sanguinem fundet juxta basim altaris holocausti in vestibulo tabernaculi.
verses.english: And he must put some of that same blood on the horns of the altar of pleasing incense before the Lord, which is inside the Tabernacle of the Testimony. The rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar for burnt offerings, which stands at the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Et omnem adipem vituli pro peccato, tumen, quod operit intestina, et quicquid intra jecur est,
verses.english: Then he shall remove all the fat from the bull offered for sin: the fat that covers the intestines, and all the fat on the intestines,

verses.latin: et duos renunculos cum adipe qui super eos est juxta ilia, et reticulum jecoris cum renunculis auferet,
verses.english: and both kidneys with the fat that is on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

verses.latin: sicut aufertur de vitulo hostiae pacificorum, et cremabit ea super altare holocausti.
verses.english: He shall remove these, just as it is removed from a young bull offered as a sacrifice of peace, and burn them on the altar for burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Pellem vero et omnes carnes cum capite et pedibus et intestinis et fimo,
verses.english: But the bull's hide, all its meat along with its head and legs, its intestines, and its dung,

verses.latin: totumque vitulum efferet extra castra in locum purum, ubi cinis effundi solet, et comburet igni super lignorum struem: in loco qui est extra castra, et mundus.
verses.english: the entire bull, he must carry outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are usually poured out. He shall burn it with fire on a pile of wood in that clean place, outside the camp.

verses.latin: Quod si omnis multitudo Israël ignoraverit, et per inadvertentiam fecerit quod contra mandatum Domini est,
verses.english: Now, if the entire congregation of Israel sins unintentionally, and through lack of attention does something against the Lord's commandment,

verses.latin: et postea intellexerit, offeret vitulum pro peccato, adducetque eum ad portam tabernaculi testimonii:
verses.english: and later realizes its sin, the community must offer a young bull as a sacrifice for sin, and bring it to the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

verses.latin: et ponent seniores ejus manus super caput ejus coram Domino, immolabuntque eum ibidem.
verses.english: Then the elders of the community shall place their hands on its head before the Lord and slaughter it there.

verses.latin: Et inferet sacerdos qui unctus est, de sanguine vituli in tabernaculum testimonii,
verses.english: The High Priest, who is anointed, must carry some of the bull's blood into the Tabernacle of the Testimony.

verses.latin: tinguetque digitum, et asperget septies contra velum.
verses.english: He shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times towards the veil.

verses.latin: Et ponet de eodem sanguine super cornua altaris quod est coram Domino in tabernaculo testimonii: reliquum autem sanguinem fundet juxta basim altaris holocausti, quod est in vestibulo tabernaculi.
verses.english: And he shall put some of that same blood on the horns of the altar that is before the Lord inside the Tabernacle of the Testimony. The rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar for burnt offerings, which is at the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Omnes autem adipem illius tollet, et cremabit super altare:
verses.english: Then he must remove all its fat and burn it on the altar.

verses.latin: sic faciens et de hoc vitulo, sicut fecit et prius: et rogante pro eis sacerdote, propitius erit Dominus.
verses.english: He shall do to this young bull just as he did to the previous one. And when the priest intercedes for them, the Lord will forgive them.

verses.latin: Ipsum vero vitulum efferet extra castra, et comburet sicut ante præceperam.
verses.english: The young bull itself he shall carry outside the camp and burn, just as I commanded before.

verses.latin: Si peccaverit princeps, et fecerit unum e cunctis mandatis Domini Dei sui per ignorantiam, atque postea intellexerit reatum suum,
verses.english: If a ruler sins unintentionally, doing something against any of the commandments of the Lord his God, and afterwards realizes his guilt,

verses.latin: offeret hostiam, hircum de capris immaculatum:
verses.english: he must offer a male goat, unblemished, as a sacrifice.

verses.latin: ponetque manum super caput ejus, et immolabit eum in loco ubi solent occidi holocausta coram Domino, quia hostia pro peccato est.
verses.english: He shall place his hand on its head and slaughter it in the place where burnt offerings are usually killed before the Lord, because it is a sacrifice for sin.

verses.latin: Et tinget sacerdos digitum in sanguine hostiae, ponetque super cornua altaris holocausti, et reliquum fundet ad basim ejus.
verses.english: Then the priest shall dip his finger in the blood of the sacrifice and put some of it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings, pouring the rest at its base.

verses.latin: Adipem vero comburet super altare, quasi hostiam holocausti: et rogante pro eo sacerdote, propitius erit illi Dominus propter peccatum.
verses.english: But he shall burn all its fat on the altar, just as with a burnt offering. And when the priest intercedes for him, the Lord will forgive him for his sin.

verses.latin: Quod si anima de populo terræ peccaverit per ignorantiam, et fecerit unum ex his quae in lege Domini prohibentur, atque deliquerit,
verses.english: If an ordinary person from the common people sins unintentionally, doing something forbidden by the Lord’s law, and thus incurs guilt,

verses.latin: et postea intellexerit peccatum suum, offeret capram immaculatam femininam.
verses.english: and afterwards realizes their sin, they must offer an unblemished female goat as a sacrifice.

verses.latin: Ponetsque manum super caput hostiae pro peccato, et immolabit illam in loco holocausti.
verses.english: They shall place their hand on the head of the sacrifice for sin and slaughter it in the place of the burnt offering.

verses.latin: Et sumens sacerdos de sanguine ejus digito suo, tinget cornua altaris holocausti, et reliquum fundet ad basim ejus.
verses.english: Then the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings, and pour the rest at its base.

verses.latin: Omnem vero adipem auferet, sicut auferri solet de victimis pacificorum, et cremabit super altare in odorem suavitatis Domino: et rogante pro eo sacerdote, propitius erit illi.
verses.english: And he shall remove all its fat, just as fat is removed from peace offerings, and burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. And when the priest intercedes for the person, the Lord will forgive them.

verses.latin: Quod si agnum obtulerit pro peccato, masculum absque macula,
verses.english: If someone offers a male lamb without blemish as a sacrifice for sin,

verses.latin: ponet manum super caput ejus, et immolabit eum in loco ubi solent holocausti immolari,
verses.english: they shall place their hand on its head and slaughter it in the place where burnt offerings are usually slaughtered.

verses.latin: sumetque sacerdos de sanguine ejus digito suo, et tinget cornua altaris holocausti, et reliquum fundet ad basim ejus.
verses.english: Then the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings, and pour the rest at its base.

verses.latin: Omnem autem adipem auferet, sicut auferri solet de ariete qui immolatur pro pacificis, et cremabit illud super altare, in incensum Domini: et rogante pro eo sacerdote, propitius erit illi pro peccato, quod commisit.
verses.english: And he shall remove all its fat, just as it is removed from the ram sacrificed for peace offerings, and burn it on the altar as an incense to the Lord. And when the priest intercedes for the person, the Lord will forgive them for the sin they committed.

verses.latin: Si peccaverit anima, et audierit vocem jurantis, et iste testis sit, vel quod ipse vidit, vel cognovit: si non indicaverit, portabit iniquitatem suam.
verses.english:
If a person commits a sin by not speaking up,
after they have heard a public oath or adjuration
calling for witnesses to testify,
and they themselves were a witness
to something they saw or knew,
but they failed to report what they knew,
then that person will be held accountable for their sin.

verses.latin: Si anima tetigerit aliquid immundum, sive cadaver bestiae immundae, sive cadaver jumenti immundi, sive cadaver reptilis immundi, et oblita fuerit, et postea recordata resciverit, polluta est et rea peccati.
verses.english:
Or if a person touches anything ritually unclean—
whether the carcass of an unclean wild animal,
or the carcass of an unclean domestic animal,
or the carcass of an unclean crawling creature—
and they were initially unaware of the ritual impurity,
but then later remember and realize it,
that person becomes ritually unclean and is guilty of sin.

verses.latin: Et si tetigerit immunditiam hominis, juxta omnem immunditiam qua pollui solet, et oblitus fuerit, et postea recordatus resciverit, reus erit.
verses.english:
Or if a person touches human uncleanness,
any kind of ritual impurity by which a person normally becomes defiled,
and they were initially unaware of it,
but then later remember and realize it,
that person will be guilty.

verses.latin: Si et anima juramento peccaverit, proferens labiis suis ut faciat malum, vel bonum, et quocumque genere jurationis, et oblita fuerit, posteaque cognoverit, deliquit.
verses.english:
Or if a person acts sinfully by making a rash vow—
swearing with their lips to do something, whether good or bad,
or making any other kind of sworn promise—
and then they forget about it,
but afterwards realize their failure to keep it,
that person has committed a transgression.

verses.latin: Quicumque ergo peccaverit in uno horum, confiteatur peccatum suum:
verses.english:
Therefore, whoever commits a sin in any of these ways
must confess their sin.

verses.latin: et offeret pro peccato suo Domino de gregibus feminam, sive agnam, sive capram, et orabit pro eo sacerdos et pro peccato illius.
verses.english:
And they shall offer for their sin to the Lord
a female animal from the flock, either a lamb or a goat.
And the priest will then make atonement for that person, for their sin.

verses.latin: Si vero non potuerit offerre pecora, offerat Domino duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ: unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum.
verses.english:
But if the person cannot afford to offer an animal from the flock,
then they shall offer to the Lord two turtledoves or two young pigeons:
one as a sin offering, and the other as a burnt offering to God.

verses.latin: Offeret sacerdos unum pro peccato primum, et retorquebit caput ejus ad collum, nec omnino abrumpet.
verses.english:
The priest shall offer the first bird as the sin offering,
wringing its head at the neck, but without fully detaching it.

verses.latin: Et asperget de sanguine ejus parietem altaris, reliquum autem ad fundamentum altaris siccabitur: quia pro peccato est.
verses.english:
And he shall sprinkle some of its blood on the side of the altar,
but the remaining blood shall be drained at the base of the altar,
because this is a sin offering.

verses.latin: Alteram vero volucrem holocausti faciet, ut fieri solet: et orabit pro eo sacerdos, et pro peccato illius, et dimittetur ei.
verses.english:
But the other bird he shall prepare as a burnt offering,
according to the usual ritual.
Then the priest will make atonement for that person, for their sin,
and they will be forgiven.

verses.latin: Quod si non quiverit offerre duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ, offeret in peccato suo decimam partem ephi similae absque oleo, et thure: quia pro peccato est.
verses.english:
But if the person cannot afford to offer two turtledoves or two young pigeons,
then for their sin, they shall offer a tenth of an ephah of fine flour.
It must be offered without olive oil and without frankincense,
because it is a sin offering.

verses.latin: Adferetque illam ad sacerdotem, qui impleta manu sua tollet inde quod monumentum sit, et incendet super altare in partem Domini.
verses.english:
And the person shall bring it to the priest,
who, taking a handful of it, will set it aside as a memorial portion,
and then burn it on the altar as a portion for the Lord.

verses.latin: Sic expiabit pro eo sacerdos, et pro peccato quod commisit, et dimittetur ei: reliquum autem habebit sacerdos sicut in munere.
verses.english:
Thus the priest will make atonement for that person,
for the sin they committed, and they will be forgiven.
The remainder of the offering, however, will belong to the priest as his portion.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Anima si praevaricans et per errorem, in his quae Domino sunt sanctificata, nescierit fecerit, offeret pro delicto suo arietem immaculatum de gregibus, qui emi potest duobus siclis justis, juxta pondus sanctuarii.
verses.english:
If a person commits a transgression and, by mistake,
unknowingly acts against what is consecrated to the Lord—
for this trespass, they shall offer an unblemished ram from the flock
as a guilt offering,
valued at two just shekels according to the sanctuary standard.

verses.latin: Quod si damnum fecit in sanctuarium, restituet, et quintam partem superaddet, tradens sacerdoti: qui orabit pro eo, offerens arietem.
verses.english:
And if the person has caused any loss concerning consecrated things,
they must make full restitution for that loss,
and add a fifth part (twenty percent) to it,
giving it to the priest.
Then the priest will make atonement for them by offering the ram.

verses.latin: Si quis per errorem fecerit, ut non intelligens faciat de his quae Domino lege prohibentur, et postea cognoverit delicti sui, portabit iniquitatem suam:
verses.english:
If a person commits a sin by mistake,
unknowingly doing something that is forbidden by the Lord's Law,
and later becomes aware of their transgression,
that person will still bear the guilt of their sin.

verses.latin: et offeret arietem immaculatum de gregibus, ad sacerdotem, juxta mensuram et æstimationem pro peccato: et orabit pro eo sacerdos super ignorantia sua, quia nescierit, et dimittetur ei.
verses.english:
And they shall bring an unblemished ram from the flock to the priest,
valued appropriately for the trespass.
Then the priest will make atonement for that person for their unintentional sin,
because they acted unknowingly, and they will be forgiven.

verses.latin: Quia per errorem deliquit in Dominum.
verses.english: This is for an unintentional transgression against the Lord.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Anima cum peccaverit, et contempto Domino, negaverit depositum proximo suo, quod fidei ejus creditum fuerat, aut vi abstulerit, aut calumniata fuerit,
verses.english:
If a person commits a sin, and thereby shows contempt for the Lord,
by denying to their neighbor a deposit that had been entrusted to their care,
or by violently taking what belongs to another,
or by committing fraud,

verses.latin: aut inventam rem negans, et super hoc pejerans: quicquid illud est, pro quo peccaverit,
verses.english:
or by denying that they found something lost,
and then swearing a false oath about it—
whatever the specific thing for which they have sinned,

verses.latin: cum hujuscemodi delicto fuerit, restituet omnia, quae per fraudem nescio quam abstulit, et quintam partem desuper addet ad dominum, cui fecerat damnum.
verses.english:
when they are guilty of such a trespass,
they must restore everything they took away by any kind of fraud,
and add a fifth part (twenty percent) to it,
giving it back to the owner whom they defrauded.

verses.latin: Et pro peccato suo, offeret arietem immaculatum de gregibus Domino, et dabit eum sacerdoti, juxta æstimationem et mensuram peccati:
verses.english:
And for their sin, they shall offer an unblemished ram from the flock to the Lord,
giving it to the priest,
valued appropriately for the measure and estimation of the sin.

verses.latin: Qui orabit pro eo coram Domino, et dimittetur illi de quocumque peccato in horum quolibet deliquit.
verses.english:
Then the priest will make atonement for them before the Lord,
and they will be forgiven for whatever sin they have committed in any of these cases.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Anima cum peccaverit, et contempto Domino, negaverit depositum proximo suo, quod apud illum fuerat derelictum, aut vi aliquid extorserit, aut calumniam fecerit,
verses.english: If a person sins by acting contemptuously toward the Lord, for example, by denying a deposit left with them by their neighbor, or by extorting something by force, or by committing fraud,

verses.latin: vel rem inventam negaverit, et super hoc pejeraverit, sive quidquam aliud ex omnibus fecerit, per quæ solet homo peccare:
verses.english: or if they have denied finding something, and then sworn a false oath concerning it; or if they have done anything else from all the ways that a person typically commits sin:

verses.latin: convicta sceleris, reddet universa quæ per fraudem obtinuit, adicietque quintam partem supra, tradens sacerdoti, pro eo quod injuste abstulit:
verses.english: once they are found guilty of this wickedness, they must return everything they gained through deceit. They must also add an additional fifth part to it, giving this total amount to the priest, as compensation for what they unjustly took.

verses.latin: et pro peccato suo, offeret arietem immaculatum de grege, et dabit eum sacerdoti, juxta æstimationem et modum, expiationis.
verses.english: And for their specific sin, they shall offer a perfect ram, without blemish, from the flock. They will give this ram to the priest for atonement, according to its assessed value and the prescribed manner of expiation.

verses.latin: Rogabitque pro eo sacerdos coram Domino: et dimittetur ei quidquid peccavit.
verses.english: The priest will then pray for them before the Lord. After this, whatever sin they have committed will be forgiven them.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Præcipe Aaron et filiis ejus: Hæc est lex holocausti: ipsum est holocaustum quod comburitur in nocte super altare usque mane: ignis autem ejus semper ardebit in illo.
verses.english: Command Aaron and his sons this: This is the law for the burnt offering, also known as the holocaust. The burnt offering is the sacrifice that is completely consumed by fire on the altar, burning from evening throughout the night until morning. The fire for this offering must always be kept burning on the altar.

verses.latin: Induet sacerdos tunicam et feminalia linea: et tollet cineres, quos combusserit ignis holocausti: et fundet juxta altare.
verses.english: The officiating priest shall put on his sacred linen tunic and linen breeches. Then he shall gather the ashes from the burnt offering—the ashes that the sacrificial fire has consumed—and pour them next to the altar.

verses.latin: Vestitusque aliis vestimentis, reponet eos extra castra in loco mundo.
verses.english: After this, he must change into different garments, and then carry the ashes outside the camp to a ceremonially clean place.

verses.latin: Ignis autem qui est in altari, semper ardebit, nec extinguetur: et succendet in eo sacerdos ligna mane singulis diebus, et imposito holocausto, desuper adolebit incensum pacis.
verses.english: The fire on the altar must always be kept burning; it shall never be allowed to go out. Every morning, the priest shall add wood to it and arrange the burnt offering on top. Then he will burn the fat of the peace offerings upon it.

verses.latin: Ignis est iste perpetuus, qui nunquam deficiet in altari.
verses.english: This fire is to be perpetual; it shall never be allowed to fail or go out on the altar.

verses.latin: Hæc est lex sacrificii pro peccato. In loco ubi immolatur holocaustum, occidetur et hoc coram Domino: sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: This is the law for the sin offering. The animal for this offering must be slaughtered in the very place where the burnt offering is sacrificed, before the Lord. This sacrifice is considered most holy.

verses.latin: Sacerdos qui comedit illud, portabit iniquitatem si quid forte de carne contigerit vestimentum ejus, lavabitur in loco sancto.
verses.english: The priest who eats of this offering must observe the ritual laws. If any of its flesh should accidentally touch his garment, that garment must be washed in a holy place to purify it.

verses.latin: Vas fictile in quo coctum fuerit, confringetur: si vero æneum fuerit, defricabitur et lavabitur aquis.
verses.english: Any clay vessel in which the offering has been cooked must be broken afterward. But if it is a bronze vessel, it shall be thoroughly scoured and washed with water.

verses.latin: Omnis masculus de stirpe sacerdotali vescetur ex eo: sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: Every male descendant of the priestly family may eat of this offering, because it is considered most holy.

verses.latin: Omne sacrificium quod offertur pro peccato, cujus sanguis infertur in tabernaculum testimonii ad expiandum in sanctuario, non comedetur, sed comburetur igni.
verses.english: However, any sin offering whose blood is brought into the Tent of Meeting—the tabernacle of testimony—to make atonement within the sanctuary, shall not be eaten. Instead, it must be completely consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc est oblatio Aaron et filiorum ejus, quam offerre debent Domino in die unctionis suæ: decimam partem ephi simulæ conspersæ oleo, jugiter, in sacrificium sempiternum.
verses.english: This is the special grain offering that Aaron and his sons must offer to the Lord on the day of their anointing: a tenth of an ephah of fine flour, mixed with oil, as a perpetual grain offering to be made regularly.

verses.latin: Media pars ejus mane, et media pars vespere offeretur.
verses.english: Half of this offering shall be presented in the morning, and the other half in the evening.

verses.latin: In sartagine oleo conspersa frixabitur: quam cum in partes et buccellas diviseris, offeres incensum odori suavissimo Domino.
verses.english: It shall be prepared in a pan, mixed with oil, and fried. After you have divided it into suitable portions and pieces, you shall offer it as a burnt offering, a truly pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Sacerdos qui successerit patri suo, et unctus fuerit eodem ritu, faciet similiter. Legitime æternum est. Uni Domino. Consumetur omnia igni.
verses.english: The priest who succeeds his father and is anointed with the same sacred ritual shall perform this offering in the same way. This is an eternal, prescribed law for the Lord alone. The entirety of this offering must be consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Omne sacrificium sacerdotis igne comburetur, nec comedetur.
verses.english: Every grain offering made by a priest shall be completely consumed by fire; it shall never be eaten.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Aaron et filios ejus: Hæc est lex sacrificii pro peccato: in loco ubi immolatur holocaustum, immolabitur et illud coram Domino: sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying: This is the law for the sin offering. The animal for this offering shall be slaughtered in the very same place where the burnt offering is slaughtered, before the Lord. This sacrifice is considered most holy.

verses.latin: Sacerdos qui offert illud pro peccato, comedet illud in loco sancto, in vestibulo tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: The priest who presents this offering for sin shall eat it in a holy place—specifically, in the court of the Tent of Meeting, which is the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.latin: Quidquid tetigerit carnes ejus, sanctificabitur: si de sanguine illius vestimentum fuerit aspersum, lavabitur in loco sancto.
verses.english: Whatever touches the flesh of the offering shall become holy. If any of its blood is sprinkled on a garment, that part of the garment must be washed in a holy place.

verses.latin: Vas fictile in quo coctum est, confringetur: si vero æneum fuerit, defricabitur et lavabitur aqua.
verses.english: Any clay vessel in which the offering has been cooked must be broken. But if it is a bronze vessel, it shall be scoured and then rinsed thoroughly with water.

verses.latin: Omnis masculus de genere sacerdotali vescetur ex eo, quia sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: Every male from the priestly family may eat of it, because it is considered most holy.

verses.latin: Omnis enim hostia quæ infertur pro peccato, cujus sanguis infertur in tabernaculum testimonii ad expiandum in sanctuario, non comedetur, sed comburetur igni.
verses.english: However, any sin offering—any victim whose blood is brought into the Tent of Meeting, which is the tabernacle of testimony, to make atonement in the sanctuary—shall not be eaten. Instead, it must be completely consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Haec quoque lex est hostiae pro peccato. Sanctissimum est.
verses.english: These are the laws for the sin offering, which is most holy.

verses.latin: Ubi immolatur holocaustum, ibi et victima pro peccato mactabitur: sanguisque ejus per gyrum altaris fundetur.
verses.english: Just as with the burnt offering, the sin offering is to be sacrificed in the place where the burnt offering is killed. Its blood is to be poured out all around the altar.

verses.latin: Omnem adipem ejus offerent: caudam quoque et adipem qui vitalia operit, et duos renunculos cum adipe suo, quo renes teguntur, et reticulum jecoris cum renunculis.
verses.english: They must offer all its fat: the fat tail (especially prominent in certain sheep breeds), the fat covering the entrails, both kidneys with the fat that covers them, and the fatty lobe of the liver, which is typically removed along with the kidneys.

verses.latin: Et adolebit ea sacerdos super altare: incensum Domino est pro peccato.
verses.english: The priest shall then burn these parts on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord, an offering for sin.

verses.latin: Omnis masculus de sacerdotali genere, vescentur de carnibus ejus in loco sancto: quia sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: Every male in the priestly family is permitted to eat its flesh in a holy place, because this offering is most holy.

verses.latin: Similiter et de hostia pro delicto. Sanctum sanctorum est: sacerdotum est.
verses.english: The same rules apply to the trespass (or guilt) offering: it is most holy, and it belongs to the priests.

verses.latin: Sacerdos qui offeret eam, ipse comedet.
verses.english: The priest who presents it as an offering is the one who shall eat it.

verses.latin: Quod si offeratur holocaustum, ejus sacerdotis erit cuius manu fusus est sanguis.
verses.english: Whenever a burnt offering is made, the hide of the animal, which is not burned, shall belong to the priest whose hand poured out its blood.

verses.latin: Et omne sacrificium similae, quod coctum fuerit in clibano, et quidquid in craticula, vel in sartagine praeparatum, ejus erit sacerdotis a quo offertur.
verses.english: Every grain offering that is baked in the oven, or prepared on the griddle, or in a pan, shall belong to the priest who offers it.

verses.latin: Sive consersum oleo, sive aridum, cunctis filiis Aaron aequa portione dabitur.
verses.english: Any grain offering, whether mixed with oil or dry, shall be given to all the sons of Aaron in equal shares.

verses.latin: Haec est lex hostiae pacificorum, quae offertur Domino.
verses.english: This is the law for the peace offering that is presented to the Lord.

verses.latin: Si pro gratiarum actione fuerit oblatio, offerent panes absque fermento conspersos oleo, et lagana azyma uncta oleo, et similam frictam et collyridas oleo mixtas.
verses.english: If someone offers it as a thank offering, they must present unleavened loaves mixed with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and fine flour fried with oil, along with thin cakes mixed with oil.

verses.latin: Panes quoque fermentatos cum hostia gratiarum, quae immolatur pro pacificis.
verses.english: They must also offer leavened loaves along with the thank offering, which is sacrificed as part of the peace offerings.

verses.latin: Ex quibus singulos panes, unum de singulis hostiis, offerent Domino in primitiis: et sacerdotis erunt qui fundit hostiae sanguinem.
verses.english: From each kind of bread, they shall present one loaf to the Lord as a heave offering for the firstfruits. These loaves will then belong to the priest who pours out the animal’s blood.

verses.latin: Carnes autem hostiae pacificorum, quam oblatione gratiarum immolat, in eadem die comedentur: nec remanebit ex eis quidquam usque mane.
verses.english: The flesh of the peace offering, which is sacrificed as a thank offering, must be eaten on the very same day it is offered. Nothing from it may be left until the next morning.

verses.latin: Si voto, vel sponte, et non pro gratiarum actione offertur hostia, in eadem die comedetur: sed et altera die, si quid reliquum fuerit, vesci licitum est.
verses.english: If the offering is made because of a vow, or as a freewill offering, and not as a thank offering, then it may be eaten on the day it is offered, but any remaining portion may be eaten on the second day.

verses.latin: Quidquid autem tertio die superfuerit, comburetur igni.
verses.english: But any part of the offering that is left over by the third day must be completely burned with fire.

verses.latin: Si quis de carnibus hostiae pacificorum comederit die tertio, irrita fiet oblatio, nec proderit offerenti: quin potius quaecumque anima tali fuerit commacuta, praevaricationis rea erit.
verses.english: If anyone eats the flesh of the peace offering on the third day, the offering will not be accepted, and it will bring no benefit to the one who presented it. Furthermore, any person who partakes of such defiled meat shall be held guilty of a serious transgression against God’s law.

verses.latin: Caro quae aliquid tetigerit immundum, non comedetur, sed comburetur igni. Qui comederit ex ea, commaculabitur.
verses.english: Any meat that touches something unclean must not be eaten; instead, it must be completely burned with fire. Whoever eats of such defiled meat will become unclean themselves.

verses.latin: Quae si fuerit munda, et quicumque de ea comederit, et fuerit immundus, peribit anima illius de populis suis.
verses.english: However, if the meat itself is clean, but a person who is ritually unclean eats from it, that person will be cut off from their people and their spiritual lineage.

verses.latin: Et si anima tetigerit immunditiam hominis, vel jumenti, vel cujuslibet rei quae polluere potest, et comederit de carnibus horum pacificorum, peribit de populis suis.
verses.english: And if a person touches human uncleanness, or the uncleanness of any animal, or anything else that can defile, and then eats from the flesh of these peace offerings, that person shall be cut off from their people.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël: Adipem omnis bovis, et ovis, et caprae, non comedetis.
verses.english: Say to the children of Israel: 'You must not eat the fat from any ox, sheep, or goat.'

verses.latin: Adipem cadaveris, et ejus quod a bestia fuerit captum, habebitis in diversos usus: si usibus tantum quispiam praevalet, ad vescendum penitus prohibetur.
verses.english: The fat from an animal that dies naturally or is torn by wild beasts may be used for other practical purposes (such as making soap or fuel for lamps), but it is absolutely forbidden for food.

verses.latin: Si quis adipem immolaverit, qui offerri debet Domino, peribit de populo suo.
verses.english: If anyone eats the fat of an animal from which a fire offering is made to the Lord, that person shall be cut off from their people.

verses.latin: Sanguinem quoque omnis carnis non comedetis in cunctis habitationibus vestris.
verses.english: Moreover, in all your settlements, you must not eat any blood from any creature that has flesh.

verses.latin: Quaecuque anima comederit sanguinem, peribit de populis suis.
verses.english: Whoever eats any blood, that person shall be cut off from their people.

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël: Qui immolat victimam pacificorum, offerat simul et libamenta, id est, manuum suarum munus.
verses.english: Say to the children of Israel: 'Whoever brings a peace offering to the Lord must present his offering to the Lord from what he has brought, as a gift from his own hands (this refers to the ritual of the wave offering).

verses.latin: Manus ejus portabunt incensum et adipem, quae separata sunt a carnibus.
verses.english: With his own hands, he must bring the fat (which is burned as a pleasing aroma) and the breast, which have been separated from the rest of the meat, to be presented to the Lord as a fire offering.

verses.latin: Atque adolebit sacerdos adipem super altare: pectus vero Aaron et filiorum ejus erit.
verses.english: The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast portion of the animal is to belong to Aaron and his sons.

verses.latin: Armus quoque dexter, de pacificorum hostiis, cedet in primitias sacerdotis.
verses.english: Furthermore, the right thigh (often referred to as the shoulder or upper arm in other contexts) from the peace offerings shall be given to the priest as his priestly portion.

verses.latin: Qui immolaverit sanguinem et adipem, ipse habebit armum dextrum sibi in partem.
verses.english: The priest who offers the blood and the fat of the peace offering shall receive the right thigh as his own share.

verses.latin: Pectus enim elationis, et armum separationis, tuli a filiis Israël, de hostiis eorum pacificis: et dedi Aaron sacerdoti, et filiis ejus, lege sempiterna.
verses.english: For I have taken the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering from the children of Israel, from their peace offerings. I have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their perpetual due, by an everlasting statute.

verses.latin: Haec est unctio Aaron et filiorum ejus, de victimis Domini: in die qua applicavit eos ut sacerdotio fungerentur.
verses.english: This is the priestly due and portion for Aaron and his sons from the offerings made to the Lord, given to them on the day they were brought forward to serve as priests.

verses.latin: Quae praecepit Dominus dari eis a filiis Israël, religiosa observatione, in sempiternum.
verses.english: The Lord commanded these portions to be given to them by the children of Israel as a religious observance, to be upheld forever.

verses.latin: Ista est lex holocausti, et sacrificii pro peccato, atque pro delicto, et pro consecratione, et pacificorum hostiarum.
verses.english: These are the laws concerning the burnt offering, the sin offering, the trespass (or guilt) offering, the consecration offering for priests, and the peace offerings.

verses.latin: Quas constituit Dominus Moysi in monte Sinai, quando mandavit filiis Israël ut offerrent oblationes suas Domino in deserto Sinai.
verses.english: These are the laws that the Lord established for Moses on Mount Sinai, when He commanded the children of Israel to present their offerings to the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Tolle Aaron cum filiis suis, vestes, et unctionis oleum, vitulum pro peccato, arietem in holocaustum, canistrum cum azymis:
verses.english: “Gather Aaron and his sons, along with the sacred garments, the anointing oil, a calf for the sin offering, a ram for the burnt offering, and a basket filled with unleavened bread.

verses.latin: et congregabis omnem coetum ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: Then you shall assemble the entire congregation at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Meeting.”

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Moyses cuncta quæ præceperat Dominus: congregataque omni turba ante fores.
verses.english: So Moses did everything the Lord had commanded. And all the congregation gathered at the entrance.

verses.latin: Et ait: Iste est sermo, quem jussit Dominus fieri.
verses.english: Moses said to the assembly: “This is what the Lord has commanded to be done.”

verses.latin: Statimque adduxit Aaron et filios ejus: cumque lavisset eos aqua,
verses.english: Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward. He washed them with water,

verses.latin: induit pontificem tunica linea, et accinxit eum balteo, et vestivit stola, et imposuit super eum ephod,
verses.english: and he clothed Aaron, the High Priest, with the tunic. He wrapped the sash around him, put the robe on him, and then placed the ephod on him.

verses.latin: adjungens ei superhumeralem, et copulans ratiocinabile cum balteo ejus.
verses.english: He fastened the woven band of the ephod to Aaron’s shoulder and secured the breastplate with its own artistic sash.

verses.latin: Et imposuit in eo rationale, in quo erat doctrina et veritas. Ligavitque mitram super caput ejus: superque mitram, contra faciem ejus, laminam auream, sanctificatum diadema, sicut præceperat Dominus ei.
verses.english: He put the breastplate on Aaron, which contained the Urim and Thummim (the “Lights and Perfections” for divine revelation). He placed the turban on Aaron’s head, and on the front of the turban, he affixed the golden plate—the holy diadem, just as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Tulitque oleum unctionis, et unxit tabernaculum cum omni supellectili sua.
verses.english: Then Moses took the anointing oil and consecrated the Tabernacle and all its furnishings by anointing them.

verses.latin: Cumque sanctificasset ea, aspersit altare septem diebus, et unxit illud, et omnia vasa ejus in sanctificationem.
verses.english: After consecrating them, he sprinkled the altar seven times, anointing it and all its utensils to consecrate them fully.

verses.latin: Effuditque de oleo super caput Aaron, et unxit eum.
verses.english: He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head and anointed him, setting him apart for his sacred office.

verses.latin: Adduxit et filios ejus, et induit eos tunicis lineis, et cinxit balteo, posuitque mitras, sicut jussit Dominus.
verses.english: Moses then brought Aaron’s sons forward and clothed them with tunics, sashed them with sashes, and placed headbands on them, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Tulit et vitulum pro peccato: cumque super caput ejus Aaron et filii ejus manum imposuissent,
verses.english: Next, he brought the calf for the sin offering. Aaron and his sons placed their hands on the head of the calf,

verses.latin: immolavit Moyses: haustoque sanguine, tincto digito tetigit cornua altaris per gyrum, lustravitque illud. Fundens autem reliquum sanguinem juxta basim altaris, sanctificavit illud in expiationem.
verses.english: and Moses slaughtered it. Taking some of the blood, he put his finger into it and touched the horns of the altar all around, purifying it. He then poured the remaining blood at the base of the altar, thereby consecrating it to make atonement for it.

verses.latin: Adipem vero qui erat super vitalia, et reticulum jecoris, ac duos reniculos cum arcinis suis, cremavit super altare:
verses.english: He took all the fat covering the entrails, the fatty lobe of the liver, and both kidneys with their fat, and burned them up in smoke on the altar.

verses.latin: pellem cum carnibus et fimo, combussit extra castra, sicut præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: But the hide, the meat, and the dung of the calf he burned outside the camp, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Obtulit et arietem in holocaustum: imposueruntque super caput ejus Aaron et filii ejus manus.
verses.english: Then Moses presented the ram for the burnt offering. Aaron and his sons placed their hands on its head.

verses.latin: Quod cum immolasset, fundens sanguinem per gyrum altaris,
verses.english: When Moses had slaughtered it, he sprinkled the blood around all sides of the altar.

verses.latin: ipsum arietem in partes concidit: et caput, et frusta, atque adipem, combussit igni.
verses.english: He cut the ram into pieces, and then burned the head, the pieces, and the fat in smoke upon the altar.

verses.latin: Lotis prius visceribus et pedibus, totum arietem simul in ara cremavit, eo quod esset holocaustum suavissimi odoris Domino, sicut præceperat ei Dominus.
verses.english: After washing the entrails and the legs, Moses burned the entire ram on the altar. This was a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Obtulit et arietem secundum, in consecrationem sacerdotum: imposueruntque Aaron et filii ejus manus super caput ejus.
verses.english: Then he presented the second ram, the ram of ordination for the priests. Aaron and his sons placed their hands on its head.

verses.latin: Quod cum immolasset Moyses, tulit de sanguine ejus, et tetigit extremum auriculæ dextræ Aaron, et pollicem manus ejus dextræ, similliter et pedis ejus dextri.
verses.english: When Moses had slaughtered it, he took some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

verses.latin: Adduxit et filios Aaron: et de sanguine, qui residuus fuerat, tetigit extremum auriculæ eorum dextræ, et pollices manuum ac pedum dextrorum: fundens autem reliquum sanguinem super altare per circuitum.
verses.english: He then brought Aaron’s sons forward and put some of the remaining blood on the lobe of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. The rest of the blood he sprinkled around the altar.

verses.latin: Tulitque adipem, et caudam, et omnem arvinam quæ operiebat vitalia, ac reticulum jecoris, et duos reniculos cum arcinis suis, et armum dextrum:
verses.english: He then took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat that covered the entrails, the fatty lobe of the liver, both kidneys with their fat, and the right thigh.

verses.latin: de canistro quoque azymorum, quod erat coram Domino, panem absque fermento, et collyridam conspersam oleo, laganumque, et posuit omnia super adipes, et armum dextrum.
verses.english: From the basket of unleavened bread that was before the Lord, he took one unleavened loaf, one cake of bread mixed with oil, and one wafer. He placed all these on top of the fat portions and the right thigh.

verses.latin: Tradiditque universa simul Aaron et filiis ejus: qui elevantes ea coram Domino,
verses.english: He put all these items together into the hands of Aaron and his sons. They presented them as a wave offering before the Lord.

verses.latin: combussit super altare, super holocaustum, eo quod consecrationis esset: odoris suavissimi Domino.
verses.english: Then Moses took them from their hands and burned them up in smoke on the altar, on top of the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Tulit et pectusculum de ariete consecrationis in suam partem, sicut præceperat ei Dominus.
verses.english: Moses also took the breast from the ram of ordination as his own portion, just as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Assumensque de oleo unctionis, et de sanguine, qui erat in altari, aspersit super Aaron et vestes ejus, et super filios ejus ac vestimenta eorum per gyrum. Sanctificavitque eos, et vestes eorum.
verses.english: Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it on Aaron and his garments, and also on his sons and their garments all around. In this way, he consecrated them and their garments.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses ad Aaron et ad filios ejus: Coquite carnes ante fores tabernaculi testimonii, et ibi comedite eas, panes quoque, qui sunt in canistro consecrationis, sicut præceptum est mihi, dicens: Aaron et filii ejus comedent ea:
verses.english: Moses then said to Aaron and his sons: “Boil the meat at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Meeting, and eat it there, along with the bread that is in the basket of ordination offerings, as I was commanded: ‘Aaron and his sons shall eat them.’

verses.latin: quidquid vero residuum fuerit de carne et de panibus, igne comburetis.
verses.english: Whatever remains of the meat and the bread you shall burn with fire.”

verses.latin: Nec consistent extra fores tabernaculi per septem dies, usque ad diem quo compleri debebunt dies consecrationis vestræ. Septem quippe diebus consecramini:
verses.english: You shall not go outside the entrance of the Tabernacle for seven days, until the days of your ordination are completed. For seven days you will be ordained by God himself.

verses.latin: sicut et nunc factum est, ut ritus impleretur, sic et in crastinum fiet.
verses.english: What has been done today is to complete the ritual; it will be done again tomorrow.

verses.latin: Per dies septem die ac nocte manebitis in castris, observantes custodias Domini, ne moriamini: sic enim mihi præceptum est.
verses.english: You shall remain at the entrance of the Tabernacle day and night for seven days, keeping the Lord’s charge, so that you do not die. For this is what I have been commanded.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque Aaron et filii ejus omnia quæ locutus est Dominus per manum Moysi.
verses.english: So Aaron and his sons did everything the Lord had commanded through Moses.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in die octavo, vocavit Moyses Aaron et filios ejus, et majores natu Israël, et ad eos locutus est:
verses.english: It happened on the eighth day—the day after their seven-day consecration period—Moses called Aaron, his sons, and the elders of Israel, and spoke to them.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad Aaron: Tolle de armento vitulum pro peccato, et arietem in holocaustum, utrumque immaculatum, et offer illos coram Domino.
verses.english: And Moses said to Aaron: 'Take a young bull from the herd for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering. Both must be without any blemish, and you must offer them before the Lord.'

verses.latin: Et ad filios Israël loqueris: Tollite hircum de capris pro peccato, et vitulum, et agnum anniculos, et immaculatos, in holocaustum.
verses.english: Then you, Aaron, must speak to the sons of Israel, saying: 'Take a male goat from the flock for a sin offering, and a yearling calf and a yearling lamb, both without blemish, for a burnt offering.'

verses.latin: Et bovem, et arietem, pacifica, et immaculata, ut immolentur coram Domino: et simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium: omnia enim hodie offerentur coram Domino.
verses.english: Also, take an ox and a ram for peace offerings, both without blemish, so that they may be sacrificed before the Lord. And include fine flour mixed with olive oil for a grain offering. For all these things will be offered before the Lord today.

verses.latin: Tulerunt ergo omnia quæ præceperat Moyses, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii: stetitque omnis multitudo.
verses.english: So they brought all the things that Moses had commanded to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony, and the whole assembly stood there.

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses: Iste est sermo quem jussit Dominus: facite, et apparebit vobis gloria Domini.
verses.english: And Moses said: 'This is the very thing the Lord has commanded you to do. Perform these rituals, and the glorious presence of the Lord will become visible to you.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Aaron: Accede ad altare, et immola pro peccato tuo hostiam, et holocaustum, et roga pro te et pro populo: et hostiam populi immola, sicut præcepit Dominus.
verses.english: Then Moses said to Aaron: 'Approach the altar, and offer your own sin offering and your burnt offering. Make intercession for yourself and for the people. After that, offer the people's offering, just as the Lord has commanded.'

verses.latin: Confestim Aaron accedens ad altare, immolavit vitulum pro peccato suo.
verses.english: Immediately, Aaron approached the altar and sacrificed the young bull for his own sin offering.

verses.latin: Adduxeruntque filii ejus sanguinem ad eum: quem intingens digitum, tetigit cornua altaris, et fudit ad radices ejus.
verses.english: And his sons brought the blood to him. He dipped his finger into the blood, touched the horns of the altar, and then poured the remaining blood at the base of the altar.

verses.latin: Adipemque, et renunculas, ac reticulum jecoris, quæ sunt de victimis pro peccato, cremavit super altare:
verses.english: Then, from the sin offering, he burned the fat, the kidneys, and the fatty lobe of the liver upon the altar.

verses.latin: Carnes vero, et pellem, et caput, ac pedes, et intestina, extra castra combussit.
verses.english: However, the animal's flesh, its hide, its head, its legs, and its entrails—he burned these outside the camp, utterly consuming them.

verses.latin: Immolavit et holocausti victimam juxta ritum: adduxeruntque filii ejus ei sanguinem, quem fudit per circuitum altaris.
verses.english: He also sacrificed the burnt offering according to the prescribed ritual. His sons brought him the blood, which he then poured all around the perimeter of the altar.

verses.latin: Ipsam vero hostiam cum frustis, et caput, et singula membra, combussit igni super altare.
verses.english: But the offering itself—that is, the pieces of the animal, its head, and each individual limb—he completely consumed with fire upon the altar.

verses.latin: Intestina quoque, et pedes lavit aqua, et simul cremavit super altare.
verses.english: He also washed the entrails and the legs with water, and then burned them together upon the altar.

verses.latin: Offerensque populi hostiam, tulit hircum qui erat pro peccato illorum, et immolavit illum, purgato altare:
verses.english: Then Aaron presented the people's offering. He took the male goat that was designated for their sins and sacrificed it, thereby purifying the altar through this ritual.

verses.latin: Attulit et holocaustum, et posuit super altare, sicut se habet in cæreminiis.
verses.english: He also brought the burnt offering and placed it upon the altar, performing the ritual precisely as it is prescribed in the ceremonies.

verses.latin: Offerens et sacrificium, quod ex simila erat conspersum oleo, implevit manum suam, et cremavit illud super altare, absque holocausto.
verses.english: He also presented the grain offering, which consisted of fine flour mixed with olive oil. He took a handful of it and burned it upon the altar, separate from the burnt offering.

verses.latin: Immolavit et bovem et arietem, pacifica pro populo: adduxeruntque filii ejus ei sanguinem, quem fudit super altare in circuitu.
verses.english: Then he sacrificed the ox and the ram as peace offerings for the people. His sons brought him the blood, which he poured all around the altar.

verses.latin: Adipes autem boum, et arietum, et caudas, et renunculas, et reticulum jecoris, quæ de victimis sunt:
verses.english: But the fat portions of the oxen and the rams, along with their fatty tails, the kidneys, and the fatty lobe of the liver—all these parts came from the peace offerings.

verses.latin: posuerunt super pectora: et cum cremaverunt adipes in altari,
verses.english: They placed these fatty parts on top of the priests' portion of the breasts. Then, when they burned all the fat portions on the altar,

verses.latin: pectora cum armo dextro separavit Aaron in eleemosynam coram Domino, sicut præceperat Moyses.
verses.english: Aaron set aside the breasts along with the right thigh as a priestly portion—a wave offering presented before the Lord, just as Moses had been commanded.

verses.latin: Elevatisque manibus Aaron in populum, benedixit eis: et descendens, implevit sacrificium pro peccato, et holocaustum, et pacifica.
verses.english: Then Aaron raised his hands towards the people and blessed them. After descending from the altar, he completed the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings.

verses.latin: Ingressique Moyses et Aaron tabernaculum testimonii, et egressi benedixerunt populo: apparuitque gloria Domini cunctæ multitudini.
verses.english: After this, Moses and Aaron entered the Tabernacle of Testimony. When they came out, they blessed the people, and immediately, the glorious presence of the Lord became visible to the entire assembly.

verses.latin: Et ecce, egressus ignis a Domino, devoravit holocaustum, et adipes, quæ erant super altare: quod cum vidissent omnes, conclamantes laudaverunt Dominum, proni in faciem.
verses.english: And behold, fire miraculously came forth from the Lord's presence and instantly consumed both the burnt offering and the fat portions that were on the altar. When everyone witnessed this, they all shouted together in praise to the Lord, falling prostrate on their faces in reverence.

verses.latin: Audiens autem Nadab et Abiu filii Aaron, tulerunt thuribula sua: et injecto igne, posuerunt incensum super illum, offerentes coram Domino ignem alienum, qui sibi præceptus non erat.
verses.english: Then Nadab and Abihu, Aaron’s sons, took their censers. They put fire into the censers and placed incense upon that fire. This act was an unauthorized offering before the Lord, a type of fire that God had not commanded them to use in worship.

verses.latin: Egressusque ignis a Domino, devoravit eos: et mortui sunt coram Domino.
verses.english: Immediately, a fire came directly from the Lord and consumed them. They died in the presence of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses ad Aaron: Hoc est quod locutus est Dominus: Sanctificabor in his qui appropinquant mihi, et in conspectu omnis populi glorificabor. Quod audiens Aaron, tacuit.
verses.english: Then Moses said to Aaron, "This is the meaning of what the Lord declared: 'I will be recognized as holy by those who draw near to me in worship, and before all the people, I will be glorified.'" When Aaron heard this, he remained silent, understanding God's judgment.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Moyses Misael et Elzaphan filios Oziel patrui Aaron, et ait ad eos: Ite, et auferte fratres vestros de conspectu sanctuarii, et extra castra.
verses.english: Then Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, who were the sons of Aaron’s uncle Uzziel. He told them, "Go and carry your kinsmen away from the front of the holy place, and take them outside the camp for burial."

verses.latin: Qui statim tulerunt eos cum tunicis suis, et ejecerunt extra castra, sicut præceperat Moyses.
verses.english: They immediately took them, still in their priestly tunics, and carried them outside the camp, just as Moses had commanded.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Moyses ad Aaron, et ad Eleazar et Ithamar filios ejus, qui residui erant: Capita vestra nolite nudare, et vestimenta scindere, ne forte moriamini, et super omnem cœtum Domini indignatio perveniat. Fratres vestri, et omnis domus Israël, plangant incendium quod Dominus excitavit:
verses.english: Then Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his remaining sons: "Do not uncover your heads, and do not tear your garments in mourning. Do not do this, lest you yourselves die and the Lord’s anger come upon all the congregation. Instead, let your relatives and all the house of Israel mourn the burning which the Lord has sent."

verses.latin: sed et vos ostium tabernaculi non egrediemini, ne moriamini: quia oleum unctionis Domini est super vos. Qui fecerunt omnia juxta præceptum Moysi.
verses.english: "And you yourselves must not leave the entrance of the tabernacle. Do not leave, lest you die, because the anointing oil of the Lord is upon you." So they did everything according to Moses’ command.

verses.latin: Locutus est quoque Dominus ad Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord also spoke to Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Vinum et omne quod inebriare potest, non bibetis vos, et filii vestri, quando intratis tabernaculum testimonii, ne moriamini: præceptum sempiternum erit in generationes vestras:
verses.english: "You, and your sons with you, must not drink wine or any intoxicating drink when you enter the tent of meeting. If you do, you will die. This is to be a perpetual statute throughout your generations."

verses.latin: et ut discernatis quid sit sanctum et quid non sanctum, et quid pollutum et quid mundum:
verses.english: "This command is given so that you may distinguish between what is holy and what is not holy, and between what is defiled and what is clean."

verses.latin: et doceatis filios Israël omnia legitima mea quæ locutus est Dominus ad eos per manum Moysi.
verses.english: "And it is so that you may teach the children of Israel all My statutes which the Lord has spoken to them through Moses."

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses ad Aaron, et ad Eleazar et Ithamar filios ejus, qui residui erant: Tollite sacrificium quod remansit de oblatione Domini, et comedite illud absque fermento juxta altare, quia sanctum sanctorum est:
verses.english: Then Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his remaining sons: "Take the grain offering that remains from the Lord's offerings and eat it without leaven beside the altar. Do this because it is most holy."

verses.latin: in loco sancto comedetis illud: idcirco enim datum est tibi et filiis tuis de sacrificiis Domini, atque pars tua.
verses.english: "You shall eat it in a holy place, for it has been given to you and your sons as your portion from the sacrifices of the Lord."
