verses.latin: Pectus quoque elevatum, et armum separatumi, in omni loco mundissimo comedetis vos, et filii vestri, et filiæ vestræ cum vobis: ad jus enim vestrum, et filiorum vestrorum et filiarum vestrarum, separata sunt de hostiis pacificorum filiorum Israël.
verses.english: "Also, the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented as a heave offering, you, your sons, and your daughters with you, shall eat in any clean place. For these are assigned to you and to your sons and daughters as your due portion from the peace offerings of the children of Israel."

verses.latin: Eo quod oblationis et separationis sint armus et pectus, quæ elevantur coram Domino, et pertineant ad jus tuum et filiorum tuorum lege perpetua, sicut præcepit Dominus.
verses.english: "The thigh and the breast are your due because they are the offerings of elevation and separation, which are presented before the Lord. These belong to you and your sons by a perpetual statute, just as the Lord has commanded."

verses.latin: Hircum quoque qui fuerat oblatus pro peccato, cum sollicite quæreret Moyses, invenit incensum: iratusque contra Eleazar et Ithamar filios Aaron qui residui erant, ait:
verses.english: Moses carefully inquired about the goat that had been offered for the sin offering, and he found that it had been burned completely. Being angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, he said:

verses.latin: Cur non comedistis pro peccato juxta sanctuarium, cum sit sanctum sanctorum, et datum vobis ut portetis iniquitatem multitudinis, et rogetis pro ea in conspectu Domini?
verses.english: "Why did you not eat the sin offering in the holy place? It is most holy, and it was given to you to remove the iniquity of the congregation and to make atonement for them before the Lord."

verses.latin: Sanguis ejus non est illatus intra sancta, et intra sanctuarium: et debueratis comedere illud in sancto, sicut præceptum est.
verses.english: "Its blood was not brought inside the holy place and into the sanctuary, so you should have eaten it in the holy place, as it was commanded."

verses.latin: Respondit Aaron: Mihi hodie oblata est victima pro peccato et holocaustum: scitis quæ acciderunt mihi: si comederem carnes ejus hodie, placeret Domino?
verses.english: Aaron answered Moses: "Indeed, today a sin offering and a burnt offering have been presented before the Lord. But you know what misfortunes have happened to me this day – the death of my sons. If I had eaten its flesh today, would it have pleased the Lord?"

verses.latin: Quo audito, statim probavit Moyses.
verses.english: When Moses heard this, he immediately approved.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them:

verses.latin: Loquimini filiis Israel: Haec sunt animalia quae comedere debetis de cunctis animantibus terrae.
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel. These are the living creatures you are permitted to eat from all the animals on the earth.

verses.latin: Omne quod habet ungulam divisam, et ruminat, comedetis.
verses.english: Any animal that has a hoof which is divided—that is, split into two separate parts—and that also chews the cud, you are permitted to eat.

verses.latin: Quidquid autem ruminat quidem, et ungulam non habet divisam, sicut camelus, et cetera, immundum erit vobis.
verses.english: But any creature that chews the cud yet does not have a divided hoof, such as the camel and similar animals, will be considered ritually unclean for you.

verses.latin: Cherogryllus qui ruminat, ungulam non dividit, et immundus est.
verses.english: The rock badger—a creature that chews the cud but does not have a divided hoof—is ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Lepus quoque ruminat quidem, sed ungulam non dividit, et immundus est.
verses.english: Likewise, the rabbit, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof, and so it is ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Sus etiam, quia habet ungulam divisam, sed non ruminat, immundus est.
verses.english: The pig, too, has a divided hoof but does not chew the cud, and so it is ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Carnes eorum non comedetis, et cadavera non tangetis: quia immunda sunt vobis.
verses.english: You are not permitted to eat the meat of these animals, nor are you permitted to touch their dead bodies, for they are ritually unclean for you.

verses.latin: Haec sunt quae comedere potestis ex omnibus animantibus, quae morantur in aquis: omne quod habet pinnulas et squamas, tam in mari quam in fluminibus et stagnis, comedetis.
verses.english: These are the kinds of creatures you are permitted to eat from all the living things that dwell in the waters: Anything that has fins and scales, whether in the sea, in rivers, or in ponds, you are permitted to eat.

verses.latin: Quidquid autem pinnulas et squamas non habet, de his quae moventur in aquis, et de his quae vivunt in fluminibus et stagnis, immundum erit vobis.
verses.english: But anything that does not have fins and scales, among the creatures that move in the waters, and among those that live in rivers and ponds, will be ritually unclean for you.

verses.latin: Et abominabimini carnes eorum, et cadavera contemnetis.
verses.english: You must consider their flesh detestable, and you must avoid their dead bodies.

verses.latin: Cuncta quae non habent pinnulas et squamas in aquis, immunda erunt.
verses.english: All creatures in the waters that do not have fins and scales will be ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Haec sunt quae de avibus non debetis comedere, et vitanda sunt vobis: aquila, et gryps, et haliaeetus,
verses.english: These are the birds you are not permitted to eat, and they must be avoided by you: the eagle, the lammergeier (a type of vulture), and the sea eagle,

verses.latin: milvus, ac vultur juxta genus suum,
verses.english: the kite, and every kind of falcon or hawk,

verses.latin: et omne corvini generis in similitudinem suam.
verses.english: and every kind of raven.

verses.latin: Struthio, et noctua, et larus, et accipiter juxta genus suum,
verses.english: the ostrich, the little owl, the seagull, and every kind of hawk,

verses.latin: bubio, et mergus, et ibis,
verses.english: the screech owl, the cormorant, and the ibis,

verses.latin: cygnus, et onocrotalus, et porphirio,
verses.english: the swan, the pelican, and the purple heron,

verses.latin: herodius, et charadrius juxta genus suum, upupa quoque, et vespertilio.
verses.english: the stork, and every kind of plover, also the hoopoe, and the bat.

verses.latin: Omne de volucribus quod graditur super quatuor pedes, abominabile erit vobis.
verses.english: Every winged creature that walks on four legs is to be considered detestable by you.

verses.latin: Extra illa tamen quae per quatuor pedes incedunt, et quibus sunt a posteriore parte crura longiora, ut salire possint super terram.
verses.english: However, you are permitted to eat those among the winged creatures that walk on four legs, but which also have longer legs at the back, enabling them to leap upon the ground.

verses.latin: Haec comedere potestis: bruchum in genere suo, et attacum atque ophiomachum, ac locusta, singula juxta genus suum.
verses.english: You are permitted to eat these: every kind of locust, the bald locust, the cricket, and the grasshopper, each according to its own kind.

verses.latin: Omne autem de reptilibus quod quatuor tantum pedes habet, abominabile erit vobis.
verses.english: But every winged creature that has only four legs (and no other means of propulsion) is to be considered detestable by you.

verses.latin: Et quicumque morticina eorum tetigerit, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:
verses.english: Anyone who touches the dead bodies of these creatures will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: et qui asportaverit aliquid de his, lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: And anyone who carries away any part of their dead bodies must wash his clothes, and he will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Omne animal quod habet ungulam, sed nec dividit, nec ruminat, immundum erit: et quicumque tetigerit illud, immundus erit.
verses.english: Every animal that has a hoof but neither divides it nor chews the cud will be ritually unclean. Anyone who touches such an animal will be ritually unclean.

verses.latin: De omnibus animantibus quae incedunt super quatuor pedes, haec erunt immunda, quae pedibus suis quasi manus tangunt. Quicumque cadavera eorum tetigerit, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:
verses.english: Among all the animals that walk on four legs, those that touch the ground with their paws as if they were hands are ritually unclean for you. Anyone who touches their dead bodies will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: et qui portaverit ea, lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum. Omnia haec immunda sunt vobis.
verses.english: And anyone who carries their dead bodies must wash his clothes, and he will be ritually unclean until evening. All these creatures are ritually unclean for you.

verses.latin: Haec quoque sunt de reptilibus quae moventur in terra, immunda vobis: mustela, et mus, et crocodillus singula juxta genus suum,
verses.english: These also are among the swarming creatures that move on the earth and are ritually unclean for you: the weasel, the mouse, and every kind of large lizard (like the monitor lizard),

verses.latin: mygale, et chamaeleon, et stellio, et lacerta, et talpa.
verses.english: the shrew, the chameleon, the gecko, the wall lizard, and the mole.

verses.latin: Omnia haec immunda sunt. Qui tetigerit morticina eorum, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: All these are ritually unclean. Anyone who touches their dead bodies will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Et super quidquid de his mortuum ceciderit, polluetur, tam vas ligneum, et vestimentum, quam pelles et cilicia: et in cunctis usibus apta tingentur in aqua, et immunda erunt usque ad vesperum, et sic postea purgabuntur.
verses.english: And if any dead body of these creatures falls upon an object, that object will become defiled. This applies to a wooden vessel, clothing, hides, or sacks. Any such object, if suitable for any use, must be immersed in water, and it will remain ritually unclean until evening. After that, it will be purified.

verses.latin: Vas autem fictile, in quo horum quidpiam mortuum fuerit inventum, confringetur: quia polluitur, et mundari non potest.
verses.english: But if any dead body of these creatures is found inside an earthenware vessel, that vessel must be broken, because it becomes so defiled that it cannot be cleansed.

verses.latin: Omne alimentum, quod attigerit aqua ex hujuscemodi vasculo, immundum erit: et omne liquens quod in tali vase fuerit, polluetur.
verses.english: Any food that is touched by water from such a defiled vessel will become ritually unclean. And any liquid that is in such a vessel will also become defiled.

verses.latin: Et quidquid de morticinis hujuscemodi ceciderit super illud, immundum erit: sive clibanus, sive foculus, destruentur, et immundi erunt.
verses.english: And if any of these dead bodies falls on an oven or a stove, these items will become ritually unclean. They must be broken down and destroyed because they are defiled.

verses.latin: Fontes vero et cisternae, et omnis aquarum congregatio, munda erunt: qui morticinas eorum tetigerit, polluetur.
verses.english: However, springs, cisterns, and any collection of water will remain ritually clean. But anyone who touches the dead bodies of these creatures, even in such water, will become defiled.

verses.latin: Si ceciderit quidpiam morticinum super sementem, quae serenda est, mundum erit.
verses.english: If any dead body falls on seeds that are meant for planting, the seeds will remain ritually clean.

verses.latin: Si autem aqua super sementem fuerit effusa, et postea cadat in eam morticinum, immunda erit vobis.
verses.english: But if water has been poured over the seeds, and then a dead body falls into it, the seeds will become ritually unclean for you.

verses.latin: Si mortuum fuerit animal quod licet vobis comedere, qui cadaver ejus tetigerit, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:
verses.english: If an animal that you are permitted to eat dies naturally, anyone who touches its dead body will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: et qui comederit ex eo quippiam, sive portaverit, lavabit vestimenta sua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: And anyone who eats any part of its dead body, or carries it, must wash his clothes, and he will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord God spoke to Moses, giving him these instructions:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël, et dices ad eos: Mulier, si suscepto semine conceperit, et masculum pepererit, immunda erit septem diebus, juxta dies separationis menstruæ.
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel and tell them: When a woman becomes pregnant after receiving seed, and then gives birth to a male child, she will be ritually unclean for seven days. This time of uncleanness is exactly like the days of her monthly separation.”

verses.latin: Et in die octavo circumcidetur puer.
verses.english: “On the eighth day, the boy child must be circumcised.”

verses.latin: Triginta vero et tribus diebus manebit in sanguine purificationis suæ: omnem sanctum non tanget, et in sanctuarium non ingredietur, donec impleantur dies purificationis ejus.
verses.english: “She will then remain in a state of purification from her bleeding for thirty-three more days. During this period, she must not touch anything that is holy, nor may she enter the sanctuary of God, until the full days of her purification are complete.”

verses.latin: Si autem feminam pepererit, immunda erit duabus hebdomadibus juxta ritum menstruæ: et sexaginta sex diebus manebit in sanguine purificationis suæ.
verses.english: “But if she gives birth to a female child, she will be ritually unclean for two weeks, following the same ritual for monthly separation. Then, she will remain in a state of purification from her bleeding for sixty-six more days.”

verses.latin: Completo autem tempore purificationis suæ, sive pro filio, sive pro filia, afferet agnum anniculum in holocaustum, et pullum columbæ sive turturem pro peccato, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii ad sacerdotem:
verses.english: “When the full time of her purification is complete, whether it was for a son or a daughter, she must bring a yearling lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony, bringing them to the priest.”

verses.latin: Qui offeret ea coram Domino, et orabit pro ea, et sic mundabitur a profluvio sanguinis sui. Hæc est lex parientis masculum vel feminam.
verses.english: “The priest will then present these offerings before the Lord God and pray for her. In doing this, she will be declared ritually clean from the flow of her blood. This is the ritual law for a woman who gives birth, whether to a male or a female child.”

verses.latin: Quod si non invenerit manus ejus, et non potuerit offerre agnum, sumet duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ, unum in holocaustum, et alterum pro peccato: orabitque pro ea sacerdos, et mundabitur.
verses.english: “If her financial means are not sufficient, and she cannot afford to offer a lamb, then she may take two turtledoves or two young pigeons. One will be for a burnt offering, and the other will be for a sin offering. The priest will then pray for her, and she will be declared ritually clean.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Homo, in cujus cute et carne orietur varia, sive scabies, sive macula, et fuerit in cute carnis ejus quasi plaga leprae, adducetur ad Aaron sacerdotem, vel ad unum quemlibet de filiis ejus.
verses.english: If a man develops a discolored eruption on the skin of his flesh—whether it's a scab, or a spot—and it looks like the plague of leprosy, which is a term for a severe, ritualistically 'unclean' skin condition, then he must be brought to Aaron the priest, or to any of his sons who are priests.

verses.latin: Cumque sacerdos viderit, et pilos in plaga albos et locum ipsius plagae humiliorem cute reliqua, immunditiae leprae est: et sacerdotis judicio separabit eum.
verses.english: And when the priest examines him, if the hairs in the affected area are white, and the area itself appears deeper than the rest of the skin, then it is indeed the uncleanness of leprosy, meaning it is a severe, ritually contaminating condition. The priest will then, by his judgment, declare him unclean and set him apart from the community.

verses.latin: Sin autem macula fuerit albida, et humilior cute non extet, nec pilos albos habuerit, claudent sacerdotis imperio septem diebus eum, qui varius est.
verses.english: But if the spot is whitish, and it is not deeper than the rest of the skin, nor does it have white hairs, then by the priest's command, the man with the eruption must be confined for seven days.

verses.latin: Et si septimo die visus fuerit stabit varietas ejus, nec creverit in cute, rursum claudet eum septem diebus.
verses.english: And if, on the seventh day when he is examined, his eruption has remained the same and has not spread on the skin, the priest must confine him again for another seven days.

verses.latin: Et si iterum septimo die apparuerit obscurior et non creverit in cute: mundum eum esse decernet, et lavabit homo vestimenta sua, et mundus erit.
verses.english: And if again, on the seventh day, the eruption appears faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest will declare him clean. The man must then wash his clothes, and he will be clean.

verses.latin: Quod si postea lepra, mundato jam, et ostensio sacerdoti, creverit in cute: rursus ad eum introibit.
verses.english: But if after being declared clean and having shown himself to the priest, the leprosy has spread on the skin, he must return to the priest.

verses.latin: Et sacerdos cernens crevisse eam, immundum esse decernet.
verses.english: And the priest, seeing that it has spread, will declare him unclean.

verses.latin: Plaga leprae si fuerit in homine, adducetur ad sacerdotem,
verses.english: If there is a plague of leprosy on a man, he must be brought to the priest.

verses.latin: qui cum inspexerit, atque albos pilos in cute et carnem vivam crevisse viderit,
verses.english: And when the priest has examined him, and sees white hairs on the skin, and living flesh that has grown in the affected area,

verses.latin: lepra vetustissima est, et in cute totius corporis inveterata, et mundum eum esse non judicabit, eo quod sordidus sit.
verses.english: it is a very old leprosy, and it has become chronic on the skin of his entire body. The priest will not declare him clean, because he is certainly unclean.

verses.latin: Sin autem pullulaverit lepra in cute, et operuerit omnem carnem a capite usque ad pedes, quicquid sub intuitu jacet,
verses.english: But if the leprosy has broken out over the skin and covered all the flesh from head to foot, wherever the priest's eye can see,

verses.latin: videbit sacerdos, et mundissimum eum esse decernet: eo quod totum in album colorem se transtulerit, et idcirco mundus est.
verses.english: the priest will examine him and declare him completely clean. This is because it has entirely turned to a white color, and therefore he is clean.

verses.latin: Quandocumque autem in eo caro viva apparuerit, immundus erit:
verses.english: However, whenever living flesh appears in that area, he will be unclean:

verses.latin: et tunc sacerdos, cum viderit carnem vivam, immundum eum esse judicabit.
verses.english: and then the priest, when he sees the living flesh, will judge him to be unclean.

verses.latin: Sin autem rursum versa fuerit in albedinem, et operuerit totam carnem,
verses.english: But if it turns back to whiteness again, and covers all the flesh,

verses.latin: mundum eum sacerdos judicabit.
verses.english: the priest will judge him to be clean.

verses.latin: Caro, et cutis, in qua ulcus natum est, et sanatum,
verses.english: If on a person's flesh and skin, a boil has formed and healed,

verses.latin: si post sanationem, albida cicatrix apparuerit, sive rubicunda, et ob ejus rei considerationem accesserit sacerdos,
verses.english: and after healing, a whitish or reddish scar appears, and the priest comes to examine this condition,

verses.latin: atque viderit eam humiliorem carne reliqua, et pilos albos habere, immundum eum esse decernet, plagam leprae est.
verses.english: and sees that it is deeper than the surrounding flesh and has white hairs, he will declare him unclean, for it is the plague of leprosy.

verses.latin: Quod si pilus illius coloris pristini fuerit, et aequalis cutis, et non humilior, claude eum septem diebus.
verses.english: But if the hair in the area is of its original color, and the skin is level and not deeper, he must confine the person for seven days.

verses.latin: Et si creverit, immunditiae leprae judicabis eum.
verses.english: And if it spreads, you will judge him to be unclean with leprosy.

verses.latin: Sin autem steterit in loco suo, mundum eum esse decernet sacerdos.
verses.english: But if it remains in its place, the priest will declare him clean.

verses.latin: Cutis humana, in qua ignis combustus fuerit, et in ipso quidem vulnere, color rufus et albidus apparuerit,
verses.english: If human skin has been burned by fire, and in the wound itself, a reddish or whitish color appears,

verses.latin: et sacerdos cum inspexerit, viderit pilum album in plaga, et ipsam humilem cute reliqua, immundum eum esse judicabit, quia plaga leprae in combustione orta est.
verses.english: and when the priest examines it, he sees white hair in the affected area, and the area itself is deeper than the surrounding skin, he will judge him to be unclean, because the plague of leprosy has arisen in the burn.

verses.latin: Quod si pilus coloris pristini fuerit, et aequalis cutis, et non humilior, claude eum septem diebus.
verses.english: But if the hair is of its original color, and the skin is level and not deeper, he must confine the person for seven days.

verses.latin: Et septimo die, cum inspexerit, si creverit, immundum eum esse decernet: plagam leprae est.
verses.english: And on the seventh day, when he examines it, if it has spread, he will declare him unclean: for it is the plague of leprosy.

verses.latin: Sin autem in loco suo steterit vulnus, et coloris pristini, et non humilius carne reliqua, mundabit eum sacerdos: quia ustio est plaga, et sanatur.
verses.english: But if the wound has remained in its place and is of its original color, and is not deeper than the surrounding flesh, the priest will declare him clean: because it is a burn wound, and it is healing.

verses.latin: Vir, sive mulier, in cujus capite vel barba fuerit plaga,
verses.english: If a man or a woman has a plague-like affliction on the head or beard,

verses.latin: et viderit eam sacerdos humiliorem carne reliqua, et pilos flavescentes atque tenuissimos, immundum eos esse judicabit: quia lepra est capitis et barbae.
verses.english: and the priest sees that it is deeper than the surrounding flesh, and the hairs in it are yellowish and very fine, he will judge them to be unclean: because it is leprosy of the head and beard.

verses.latin: Quod si aequalis fuerit locus plagae, et pilus coloris pristini, claude eum septem diebus.
verses.english: But if the place of the affliction is level with the skin, and the hair is of its original color, he must confine the person for seven days.

verses.latin: Et septimo die, si non creverit locus plagae, et pilus fuerit pristino colore, et aequalis cutis,
verses.english: And on the seventh day, if the place of the affliction has not spread, and the hair is of its original color, and the skin is level,

verses.latin: rasis omnibus pilis, ipse radetur, et lavabit vestimenta sua, et mundus erit.
verses.english: then with all the hair shaved off—he himself must shave it—and after washing his clothes, he will be clean.

verses.latin: Si post sanitatem, rursus creverit in capite aut in barba plaga,
verses.english: If after being declared clean, the affliction on the head or beard spreads again,

verses.latin: nec humilior fuerit carne reliqua, sed coloris pristini,
verses.english: and it is not deeper than the surrounding flesh, but the color of the affliction itself remains as it was before,

verses.latin: certus erit sacerdos, et absque omni dubitatione immundum eum esse decernet: quia crevit plaga.
verses.english: the priest will be certain and will declare him unclean without any doubt: because the affliction has spread.

verses.latin: Quod si steterit, et pilus coloris pristini fuerit, mundum esse decernet, et lavabit vestimenta sua, et mundus erit.
verses.english: But if it has remained in place, and the hair is of its original color, he will declare him clean, and he must wash his clothes, and he will be clean.

verses.latin: Vir, aut mulier, in cujus cute albae maculae apparuerint,
verses.english: If a man or a woman develops white spots on their skin,

verses.latin: videbit eos sacerdos: et si color fuerit subobscurus, aut non satis candidus, est vitiligo, et mundus est.
verses.english: the priest will examine them: and if the color is somewhat dark, or not perfectly white, it is a mild skin condition called vitiligo, and the person is clean.

verses.latin: Vir cujus capitis cæsaries defluxerit, calvus est, et mundus.
verses.english: A man whose hair has fallen out from his head is bald, and he is clean.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Haec est lex leprosi: quando fuerit mundatus, adducetur ad sacerdotem:
verses.english: “This is the law for one with leprosy: when he is declared clean, he shall be brought to the priest.

verses.latin: qui egressus de castris, cum viderit mundum esse,
verses.english: The priest will go outside of the camp, and when he sees that the person is truly clean,

verses.latin: praecipiet ut afferat qui mundandus est, duos passeres vivos, et puros, et lignum cedrinum, et coccum, et hyssopum.
verses.english: he will order the one who is to be cleansed to bring two live, ritually clean sparrows, and cedar wood, and scarlet thread, and hyssop.

verses.latin: Unum vero passerem, jubebit immolari in vase fictili super aquas vivas.
verses.english: Then, the priest will command that one of the sparrows be sacrificed in an earthenware vessel over living—that is, running—water.

verses.latin: Alterum autem vivum cum ligno cedrino, et cocco, et hyssopo, tinget in sanguine passeris immolati, atque aquis vivis:
verses.english: But the other live sparrow, along with the cedar wood, the scarlet thread, and the hyssop, he will dip into the blood of the sacrificed sparrow, and into the living water.

verses.latin: ac asperget septies eum qui mundandus est de lepra: et postquam ritus fuerit completus, dicet: Mundus es.
verses.english: And he will sprinkle it seven times upon the one who is to be cleansed from the leprosy. After this ritual is completed, he will say: 'You are clean.'

verses.latin: Cumque lotis vestibus, raso capite, et superciliis, et barba, omnes pilos corporis aboleverit, lavabit se aqua, et mundus erit:
verses.english: Then the cleansed person must wash his clothes, shave off all the hair from his head, eyebrows, and beard. He must remove all the hair from his body. He will then wash himself with water, and he will be clean.

verses.latin: et post octavum diem assumet duos agnos immaculatos, et ovem anniculam absque macula, et tres decimas similae oleo conspersae in sacrificium, et seorsum olei sextarium.
verses.english: On the eighth day, he must take two male lambs without blemish, and one yearling ewe lamb without blemish. He also needs three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, and one log of oil by itself.

verses.latin: Adducetque sacerdos qui purificat, hominem atque haec omnia coram Domino ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: The priest who performs the purification will bring the person and all these offerings before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.latin: Et stabit sacerdos statuetque eum coram Domino.
verses.english: The priest will stand and present him before the Lord.

verses.latin: Tolletque agnum unum et offeret illum in sacrificium pro delicto, et olei sextarium: et levabit simul utrumque coram Domino.
verses.english: He will take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering, along with the log of oil. He will present both of them—the lamb and the oil—as a wave offering before the Lord.

verses.latin: Immolabitque agnum ubi solent immolari hostiae pro peccato, et holocaustum in loco sancto: sicut enim pro peccato, ita et pro delicto ad sacerdotem pertinet: Sanctum sanctorum est.
verses.english: He will sacrifice the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and burnt offering are usually sacrificed. For just as the sin offering and the burnt offering belong to the priest, so does the guilt offering; it is most holy.

verses.latin: Tolleque sacerdos de sanguine hostiae quae immolata est pro delicto, et ponet super extremum auriculae dextrae ejus qui mundatur, et super pollices manus ejus dextrae, et pedis.
verses.english: The priest will take some of the blood from the guilt offering and put it on the lobe of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

verses.latin: Et de sextario olei mittet in manum suam, sacerdos, sinistram:
verses.english: Then, from the log of oil, the priest will pour some into his own left palm.

verses.latin: tingetque digitum dextrum in eo, et asperget septies contra Dominum.
verses.english: He will dip his right forefinger into the oil and sprinkle some of it seven times before the Lord.

verses.latin: Reliquam autem olei partem quae est in manu sua, fundet super caput ejus qui mundatur, et propitiabitur pro eo.
verses.english: The rest of the oil that remains in his hand he will pour on the head of the one being cleansed. In this way, the priest will make atonement for him before the Lord.

verses.latin: Faciesque sacerdos hostiam pro peccato, et de sanguine ejus, sicut antea dictum est, mundabit purificatum.
verses.english: The priest will then offer the sin offering. And using its blood, as mentioned before, he will cleanse the one who has been purified.

verses.latin: Deinde immolabit holocaustum,
verses.english: After that, he will sacrifice the burnt offering.

verses.latin: et ponet in altari tam hostiam quam libamenta ejus: atque homo mundabitur.
verses.english: He will place both the burnt offering and its grain offerings on the altar. In this way, the person will be clean.

verses.latin: Quod si pauper est, et non habet unde rata fiant, assumet agnum unum qui offeratur pro delicto, ut leveter, et in propitiationem, et tres decimas similae conspersae oleo in sacrificium, et olei sextarium,
verses.english: “Now, if the person is poor and cannot afford all these things, he must take one male lamb for a guilt offering to be waved, making atonement for him. He also needs three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, and one log of oil.

verses.latin: duasque turtures, sive duos pullos columbae, quorum unus erit pro peccato, et alter in holocaustum:
verses.english: He must also bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons, one to be offered as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.

verses.latin: afferetque ea octavo die purificationis suae ad sacerdotem, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, coram Domino.
verses.english: On the eighth day of his purification, he will bring them to the priest, at the entrance of the tent of meeting, before the Lord.

verses.latin: Tolleque sacerdos agnum pro delicto, et sextarium olei: et levabit simul utrumque coram Domino.
verses.english: The priest will take the lamb for the guilt offering and the log of oil, and wave them together as a wave offering before the Lord.

verses.latin: Immolabitque agnum pro delicto, et de sanguine ejus ponet super extremum auriculae dextrae ejus qui mundatur, et super pollices manus ejus dextrae, et pedis.
verses.english: He will then sacrifice the lamb for the guilt offering. And he will put some of its blood on the lobe of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

verses.latin: Oleum quoque mittet in manum suam sinistram,
verses.english: The priest will also pour some of the oil into his left palm,

verses.latin: et tingens digitum dextrum, asperget septies contra Dominum:
verses.english: and dipping his right forefinger into it, he will sprinkle some seven times before the Lord.

verses.latin: tangetque extremum auriculae dextrae ejus qui mundatur, et pollices manus ejus dextrae, et pedis in loco, ubi prius posuerat sanguinem hostiae quae immolata est pro delicto.
verses.english: Then he will touch the lobe of the right ear of the one being cleansed, and the thumb of his right hand, and the big toe of his right foot—specifically, on the places where he had previously put the blood of the guilt offering.

verses.latin: Reliquam autem olei partem quae est in manu sacerdotis, fundet super caput purificati, ut propitietur pro eo coram Domino.
verses.english: The rest of the oil that remains in the priest's hand he will pour on the head of the purified person, in order to make atonement for him before the Lord.

verses.latin: Offeret quoque turturem unam, sive pullum columbae,
verses.english: He will also offer one of the turtledoves or young pigeons—

verses.latin: quidquid potest reperire, unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum, juxta ritum suum:
verses.english: whichever he can afford to provide. One will be for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, according to their prescribed ritual.

verses.latin: Hoc est sacrificium leprosi, qui pro inopia rerum suarum ad purificandum se juxta legem Domini, praebere non potest.
verses.english: This is the sacrifice for the person with leprosy, who, because of his lack of resources, cannot afford to provide the full offering for his purification according to the Lord's law.”

verses.latin: Locutus est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke again to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Cum ingressi fueritis terram Chanaan, quam ego dabo vobis in possessionem, si fuerit plaga leprae in aedibus, vel domibus:
verses.english: “When you enter the land of Canaan, which I am giving to you as a possession, and if a disease of leprosy—that is, a severe mold or mildew—appears in a house or dwelling:

verses.latin: ibit dominus domus, et nuntiabit sacerdoti, dicens: quasi lepra mihi videtur esse in domo mea.
verses.english: the owner of that house must go and tell the priest, saying: 'It seems to me that something like leprosy has appeared in my house.'

verses.latin: Et praecipiet sacerdos ut efferantur cuncta de domo, priusquam ingrediatur eam, et videat utrum vera sit lepra, ne contaminentur omnia quae in domo sunt: et tunc demum intrabit, ut consideret domum.
verses.english: The priest will order that everything be taken out of the house before he enters to inspect whether it is truly the disease, so that everything inside the house will not become unclean. After this, he will finally go in to examine the house.

verses.latin: Cumque perspexerit, si maculae fuerint in parietibus ejus, quasi virentes, aut rubicundae, et humiliores superficie reliqua:
verses.english: When he inspects it, if there are spots on its walls that appear greenish or reddish, and they are sunken below the surrounding surface:

verses.latin: egredietur ostio domus, statimque claudet eam septem diebus.
verses.english: he will go out the door of the house, and immediately close it up for seven days.

verses.latin: Et revertetur septimo die: si invenerit crevisse plagam,
verses.english: He will return on the seventh day. If he finds that the affliction has spread,

verses.latin: jubebit exstrui lapides, in quibus est plaga, et projici extra civitatem in locum immundum.
verses.english: he will command that the stones in which the affliction is present be removed and thrown outside the city into an unclean place.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

verses.latin: Homo, cujuscumque sexus, si fluxu seminis sive urinae, vel alterius rei patitur labem: immundus erit.
verses.english: Any person, male or female, who suffers from an abnormal discharge of bodily fluid—such as an unusual flow of semen, or other bodily fluids—will be ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Et tunc judicabitur hoc vitium esse commune, cum ex carne ejus egreditur sputum: et quacumque de causa adnihilatur.
verses.english: This condition of ritual uncleanness will be established and declared as such when a discharge flows from his body, or even if the discharge is somehow stopped.

verses.latin: Omnis lectus in quo dormierit, immundus erit: et quicquid sederit super, immundum erit.
verses.english: Any bed on which such a person sleeps will become ritually unclean, and whatever they sit upon will also become ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Si quisquam tetigerit lectum ejus, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If anyone touches the bed of such a person, they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si sederit qui tetigerit, ubi sederat ille, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If anyone sits where the unclean person has sat, they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Qui tetigerit carnem ejus, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Whoever touches the flesh of the unclean person must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si spuerit immundus super eum qui mundus est: lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If the unclean person spits upon someone who is ritually clean, that person must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Omne sellamentum super quo sederit immundus, immundum erit.
verses.english: Every saddle or seat upon which the unclean person has ridden will become ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Et quicumque tetigerit quicquam de his, immundus erit usque ad vesperum: si portaverit, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: And whoever touches any of these things will be ritually unclean until evening. If someone carries such a thing, they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Omnis, quem tetigerit sedens immundus sine manuum suarum ablutio, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Anyone whom the unclean person touches while sitting, if the unclean person has not first washed their hands, must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Vas fictile in quo tetigerit immundus, confringetur: si ligneum fuerit, lavabitur aqua.
verses.english: Any clay vessel that the unclean person touches must be broken. But if it is a wooden vessel, it will be washed with water.

verses.latin: Postquam ergo curatus fuerit, septem dies numerabit purificationis suae, et lotis vestimentis et toto corpore in aquis viventibus, mundus erit.
verses.english: Therefore, after the person with the discharge has been healed, they must count seven days for their purification. After washing their clothes and their entire body in living—that is, running—water, they will then be ritually clean.

verses.latin: Die autem octavo assumet duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ, et veniet in conspectu Domini ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, dabitque eos sacerdoti:
verses.english: On the eighth day, such a person must take two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them before the Lord, at the entrance of the tabernacle of testimony, and give them to the priest.

verses.latin: Qui offeret unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum: orabitque pro eo sacerdos coram Domino, ut emundetur a fluxu suo.
verses.english: The priest will offer one bird as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. The priest will then pray for that person before the Lord, so that they may be cleansed from their discharge.

verses.latin: Vir, de quo egressus fuerit seminis fluxus, lavabit aqua omne corpus suum: et immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: When a man has a normal emission of semen, he must wash his entire body with water, and he will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Vestem et pellem, quam lavatur, immunda erunt usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Any garment or leather that he is wearing when this occurs will also become ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si quaverit cum muliere coitum, lavabuntur ambo aqua: et immundi erunt usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If a man and woman have intercourse, both of them must wash themselves with water, and they will both be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Mulier, quæ in menstruis est, septem diebus separabitur.
verses.english: A woman who is menstruating will be set apart for seven days.

verses.latin: Omnis qui tetigerit eam, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Anyone who touches her during this time will be ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Et in quocumque dormierit per dies separationis suae, immundum erit: et quicquid sederit super, immundum erit.
verses.english: Any bed on which she sleeps during her days of separation will become ritually unclean, and whatever she sits upon will also become ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Si quis tetigerit lectum ejus, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If anyone touches her bed, they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si quis tetigerit vas super quod sedit, lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: If anyone touches any vessel upon which she has sat, they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si dormierit vir cum ea in tempore sanguinis menstrui, immundus erit septem diebus: et omnis lectus in quo dormierit, immundus erit.
verses.english: If a man sleeps with her during the time of her menstrual blood, he will become ritually unclean for seven days, and every bed on which he sleeps will become ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Mulier quæ patitur fluxum sanguinis diebus multis, non in tempore menstruarum suarum, aut cui post menses statim sanguis superfluet, tamdiu immunda erit, quanto tempore fluxum patitur, quasi in menstruis.
verses.english: A woman who suffers a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her normal menstruation, or one whose blood continues to flow immediately after her menstruation, will remain ritually unclean for as long as she suffers the discharge, just as she would during menstruation.

verses.latin: Omnis lectus in quo dormierit per totum tempus fluxus sui, erit quasi lectus menstruatae: et quicquid sederit super, immundum erit.
verses.english: Every bed on which she sleeps throughout the entire time of her discharge will be as ritually unclean as the bed of a menstruating woman, and whatever she sits upon will also be ritually unclean.

verses.latin: Quicumque tetigerit ea, immundus erit: et lavabit vestimenta sua, et lotus aqua, immundus erit usque ad vesperum.
verses.english: Whoever touches any of these things will be ritually unclean; they must wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water, and remain ritually unclean until evening.

verses.latin: Si vero cessaverit sanguis, numerabit septem dies mundationis suae.
verses.english: If, however, the blood discharge ceases, she must count seven days for her purification.

verses.latin: Et die octavo offeret sacerdoti duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii pro peccato, et in holocaustum.
verses.english: And on the eighth day, she will bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, at the entrance of the tabernacle of testimony, for a sin offering and for a burnt offering.

verses.latin: Qui offerens unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum, orabit pro ea coram Domino, et pro fluxu immunditiae ejus.
verses.english: The priest, offering one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, will pray for her before the Lord concerning her discharge of uncleanness.

verses.latin: Sicque docebitis filios Israel ut caveant immunditiam: et non moriantur in sordibus suis, cum polluent sanctuarium meum, quod est in medio eorum.
verses.english: In this way, you are to teach the children of Israel to be careful regarding ritual uncleanness, so that they do not die in their defilements when they would otherwise pollute My sanctuary, which is in their midst.

verses.latin: Ista est lex ejus, qui fluxu seminis labitur, et ejus, qui polluitur coitu.
verses.english: This is the law for the man who has a discharge of semen, and for the man who becomes defiled through intercourse.

verses.latin: Et mulieris menstruatae, et quæ patitur fluxum sanguinis: et viri, ac mulieris, qui coeunt invicem.
verses.english: It is also the law for a menstruating woman, and for a woman who suffers a discharge of blood, and for both a man and a woman who have intercourse with each other.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Dominus ad Moysen post mortem duorum filiorum Aaron, quando occisi sunt offerentes ignem alienum.
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses after Aaron’s two sons had died, when they were killed for offering unauthorized fire, which was not according to God's command.

verses.latin: et dixit ad eum: Loquere ad Aaron fratrem tuum, ne omni tempore ingrediatur Sanctuarium quod est intra velum coram propitiatorio, quo tegitur arca, ne moriatur; non enim apparebo in nube super propitiatorium.
verses.english: And He said to him: "Speak to your brother Aaron and instruct him that he is not to enter the Most Holy Place, which is inside the veil and before the mercy seat that covers the Ark of the Covenant, whenever he wishes. If he does, he will die, because I will appear in a cloud over the mercy seat and execute judgment."

verses.latin: Hac intrabit Aaron sanctuarium: in vitulo de armento pro peccato, et in ariete in holocaustum.
verses.english: Aaron is to enter the Most Holy Place with these offerings: a young bull from the herd for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

verses.latin: Tunica linea induetur, et feminalibus lineis mutietur: zona linea accingetur, cydari quoque lineo velabitur: vestimentis enim sanctis utetur, lotis prius omni corpore.
verses.english: He is to put on a linen tunic, linen trousers for modesty, a linen sash, and a linen turban. These are holy garments, and he must bathe his entire body before putting them on.

verses.latin: Sumeque ab universa multitudine filiorum Israel duos hircos caprarum pro peccato, et arietem unum in holocaustum.
verses.english: From the entire assembly of the children of Israel, he is to take two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.

verses.latin: Cumque obtulerit Aaron vitulum et oraverit pro se et pro domo sua,
verses.english: When Aaron offers the young bull as his own sin offering, he will make atonement for himself and for his household.

verses.latin: stabunt duos hircos coram Domino in ostio tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: He will then take the two male goats and present them before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.latin: Mittetque super utrumque sortem: unam Domino, et alteram Capro emissario.
verses.english: Aaron will cast lots for the two goats: one lot for the Lord, and the other lot for Azazel, the scapegoat.

verses.latin: Quem super cujus sortem exierit Domino, offeret pro peccato:
verses.english: The goat on which the lot for the Lord falls, Aaron will offer as a sin offering.

verses.latin: cuius autem in Capro emissario, statuet vivum coram Domino, ut emittat eum in solitudinem, deprecante eo pro populo.
verses.english: But the goat on which the lot for Azazel falls, he will present alive before the Lord. It will then be sent out into the wilderness to make atonement for the people by bearing their sins.

verses.latin: Postquam vitulum pro peccato, et arietem pro holocausto obtulerit, orabit pro se et pro domo sua:
verses.english: After Aaron offers his young bull as a sin offering and his ram as a burnt offering, he will make atonement for himself and for his household.

verses.latin: assumptoque turibulo, quod de prunis altaris impleverit, et compositis super thymiama aromatibus, introibit intra velum:
verses.english: He will then take a censer full of burning coals from the altar, and two handfuls of finely ground fragrant incense, and bring them inside the veil.

verses.latin: ut, asperso super ignem thymiama, caligo et nubes ex ea operiat propitiatorium, quod est super testimonium, et non moriatur.
verses.english: So that when he puts the incense on the burning coals, the cloud of incense smoke will cover the mercy seat that is on the Ark of the Covenant, so he will not die.

verses.latin: Tollens quoque de sanguine vituli, asperget digito septies contra propitiatorium ad orientem.
verses.english: He will also take some of the blood from the young bull and sprinkle it with his finger seven times on the eastern side of the mercy seat.

verses.latin: Cumque occiderit hircum pro peccato populi, inferet et sanguinem ejus intra velum, sicut praecepit de sanguine vituli, ut aspergat illum contra propitiatorium:
verses.english: Then he will slaughter the goat for the people's sin offering and bring its blood inside the veil. He will do with its blood just as he did with the blood of the young bull, sprinkling it against the mercy seat.

verses.latin: et purescet Sanctuarium ab immunditiis filiorum Israel, et a sceleribus eorum, cunctisque peccatis. Juxta hunc ritum faciet tabernaculo testimonii, quod fixum est inter eos in medio sordium habitationis eorum.
verses.english: In this way, he will cleanse the Most Holy Place from the defilement of the children of Israel, from their transgressions, and from all their sins. He will do the same ritual for the tent of meeting, which is pitched among them in the midst of their impure dwelling.

verses.latin: Nullus hominum sit in tabernaculo quando ingreditur pontifex Sanctuarium, ut expiet pro se et pro domo sua, et pro universo coetu Israel, donec egrediatur.
verses.english: No one is to be in the tent of meeting when the high priest enters the Most Holy Place to make atonement for himself, for his household, and for the entire assembly of Israel, until he comes out.

verses.latin: Cum egressus fuerit ad altare, quod coram Domino est, oret pro se et pro populo, et sanctificans illud,
verses.english: When he comes out to the altar that is before the Lord, he will make atonement for himself and for the people, and he will consecrate it.

verses.latin: aspergat de sanguine digito septies, purificetque et sanctificet illud ab immunditiis filiorum Israel.
verses.english: He will sprinkle some of the blood on it seven times with his finger, purifying and consecrating it from the defilement of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Postquam universa mundaverit Sanctuarium, et tabernaculum testimonii, atque altare, tunc offerat hircum viventem:
verses.english: After he has finished cleansing the Most Holy Place, the tent of meeting, and the altar, he will bring forward the live goat.

verses.latin: et posita utraque manu super caput ejus, confiteatur omnes iniquitates filiorum Israel, et universa delicta atque peccata eorum: ponetque ea super caput hirci, et emittet illum per hominem paratum in solitudinem.
verses.english: He will lay both of his hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, all their transgressions, and all their sins. He will put these sins onto the head of the goat, and then send it away into the wilderness by the hand of a man appointed for this task.

verses.latin: Cumque portaverit hircus omnes iniquitates eorum in terram solitariam, et dimissus fuerit in solitudine,
verses.english: As the goat carries all their iniquities into an uninhabited land and is released into the wilderness, it signifies the removal of their sins.

verses.latin: ingredietur Aaron tabernaculum testimonii, et depositus tunicas lineas, quas prius induerat, cum intraret Sanctuarium, reponet eas ibi.
verses.english: Aaron will then go back into the tent of meeting, take off the linen garments he wore when he entered the Most Holy Place, and leave them there.

verses.latin: Et lavabit corpus suum in aqua in loco sancto, indueturque vestimentis suis: et egressus immolabit holocaustum suum, et holocaustum populi, ac deprecabitur tam pro se, quam pro populo.
verses.english: He will bathe his entire body with water in a holy place, and then put on his regular priestly garments. After he comes out, he will offer his own burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making atonement for himself and for the people.

verses.latin: Et adipem, qui oblatus est pro peccato, cremabit super altare.
verses.english: He will burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.

verses.latin: Is vero qui dimiserit caprum emissarium, lavabit vestimenta sua, et corpus suum aqua: et post haec ingredietur in castra.
verses.english: The man who led the scapegoat away will wash his clothes and bathe his body with water, and after that, he may return to the camp.

verses.latin: Vitulum vero et hircum, qui pro peccato fuerant immolati, et quorum sanguis inlatus est in Sanctuarium, ut purificaretur eo, efferent extra castra, et comburent igni tam pelles quam carnes eorum, et fimum.
verses.english: The young bull and the goat that were offered for the sin offering, whose blood was brought into the Most Holy Place to make atonement, will be carried outside the camp. Their hides, flesh, and dung will be burned with fire.

verses.latin: Et quicumque combusserit ea, lavabit vestimenta sua, et corpus suum aqua: et post haec ingredietur in castra.
verses.english: Anyone who burns them will wash his clothes and bathe his body with water, and after that, he may return to the camp.

verses.latin: Hoc erit vobis legitimum sempiternum: mense septimo, decima die mensis, affligetis animas vestras, nullumque facietis opus, sive civis, sive peregrinus, qui apud vos commoratur.
verses.english: This is to be a perpetual statute for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month, you are to afflict your souls—a solemn fast and time of repentance. You must not do any work, whether you are a native-born Israelite or a foreigner residing among you.

verses.latin: In hac die expiabitur et mundabitur vos ab omnibus peccatis vestris: coram Domino mundi efficiemini.
verses.english: For on this Day of Atonement, you will be purified and cleansed from all your sins. Before the Lord, you will be made clean.

verses.latin: Sabbatum quietis est, et affligetis animas vestras per praeceptum sempiternum.
verses.english: This is a Sabbath of solemn rest, and you are to afflict your souls, as a perpetual ordinance.

verses.latin: Faciet autem expiationem sacerdos, qui unctus fuerit, et cujus manus initiatae sunt ut sacerdotio fungatur pro patre suo: vestimentis lineis induetur, et vestimentis sanctis.
verses.english: The atonement will be made by the priest who has been anointed and consecrated to serve as high priest in his father's place. He is to put on the sacred linen garments.

verses.latin: Expiabit Sanctuarium et tabernaculum testimonii atque altare: sacerdotes quoque et universum populum.
verses.english: He will make atonement for the Most Holy Place, for the tent of meeting, and for the altar. He will also make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.

verses.latin: Eritque hoc vobis legitimum sempiternum, ut oretis pro filiis Israel, et pro cunctis peccatis eorum, semel in anno. Fecit igitur sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: This is to be a perpetual statute for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel and for all their sins once a year. So Aaron did exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him these instructions:

verses.latin: Loquere Aaron, et filiis ejus, et cunctis filiis Israel, dic: Iste est sermo, quem præcepit Dominus, dicens:
verses.english: “Speak to Aaron, to his sons, and to all the sons of Israel, saying: This is the command that the Lord has issued:

verses.latin: Homo de domo Israel, et de advenis qui peregrinantur apud vos, si occiderit hostiam, sive bovem, sive ovem, sive capram in castris, vel extra castra,
verses.english: Any man from the house of Israel, or from among the foreigners who reside among you, who slaughters an animal for sacrifice—whether an ox, a sheep, or a goat—inside the camp or outside the camp,

verses.latin: et ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii non obtulerit, ut offeratur Domino, sanguinis reus erit homo ille, quasi sanguinem fuderit: peribit de medio populi sui.
verses.english: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Witness to offer it to the Lord, that man will be considered guilty of bloodshed, just as if he had shed human blood. Therefore, that person will be cut off from among his people.

verses.latin: Ideo sacerdotes filii Israel offerre debent hostias suas Domino ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii, et immolare victimas pacificas Domino.
verses.english: For this reason, the priests, the sons of Israel, must bring their offerings to the Lord at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Witness, and there they shall slaughter their peace offerings to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et fundent sanguinem super altare Domini juxta ostium tabernaculi testimonii, et crement adipes in odorem suavitatis Domino:
verses.english: They shall pour the blood upon the Lord’s altar at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Witness, and burn the fat as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: et nequaquam ultra immolabunt hostias suas dæmonibus, cum quibus fornicati sunt. Legitimum sempiternum erit illis et posteris eorum.
verses.english: They shall never again offer their sacrifices to pagan deities, with whom they have prostituted themselves through idolatry. This will be a perpetual statute for them and for their descendants.

verses.latin: Et ad eos dices: Homo de domo Israel, et de advenis qui advenæ vobiscum sunt, si obtulerit holocaustum, sive victimam,
verses.english: Also say to them: Any man from the house of Israel, or from among the foreigners who reside among you, who offers a burnt offering or any other sacrifice,

verses.latin: et ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii non adduxerit, ut offeratur Domino, peribit de populo suo.
verses.english: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Witness to offer it to the Lord, that person will be cut off from his people.

verses.latin: Homo quoque de domo Israel, et de advenis qui peregrinantur apud eos, si comederit sanguinem, obfirmabo faciem meam contra animam illius, et interficiam eum de medio populi sui.
verses.english: Furthermore, any man from the house of Israel, or from among the foreigners who reside among them, who eats blood—I will set My face against that person, and I will cut him off from among his people.

verses.latin: Quia anima carnis in sanguine est: et ego dedi illum vobis ut super altare in eo expietis pro animabus vestris, et sanguis pro anima expiari debebit.
verses.english: This is because the very life-force of the flesh is in the blood. I have given this blood to you to pour on the altar, so that you may make atonement for your souls, because it is the blood that must make atonement for a soul.

verses.latin: Propterea dixi filiis Israel: Omnis anima vestrum non comedet sanguinem, nec ex advenis qui peregrinantur apud vos.
verses.english: Therefore, I have said to the sons of Israel: No person among you shall eat blood, nor shall any of the foreigners who reside among you eat blood.

verses.latin: Homo quoque de filiis Israel, et de advenis qui advenæ vobiscum sunt, si venatione atque aucupio ceperit feram, vel avem, quæ comedi potest, fundet sanguinem ejus, et operiet illum terra.
verses.english: Also, any man from the sons of Israel, or from among the foreigners who reside among you, who hunts and catches a wild animal or a bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth.

verses.latin: Quia anima omnis carnis in sanguine est: unde dixi filiis Israel, Sanguinem universæ carnis non comedetis, quia anima carnis in sanguine est: et quicumque comederit illum, peribit.
verses.english: For the life-force of all flesh is in its blood. This is why I have said to the sons of Israel: You shall not eat the blood of any flesh, because the life-force of the flesh is in its blood. And whoever eats it will be cut off.

verses.latin: Anima quæ comederit morticinum, vel captum a bestia, tam de indigenis quam de advenis, lavabit vestimenta sua, et se ipse aqua, et immundus erit usque ad vesperum: et hoc ritu mundus fiet.
verses.english: Any person who eats an animal that died naturally or was torn by a wild beast—whether an Israelite native or a foreigner—must wash his clothes and himself with water. He will be ritually unclean until evening; only then will he become clean through this ritual.

verses.latin: Si autem non laverit vestimenta sua, et corpus, portabit iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: But if he does not wash his clothes and his body, he will bear the consequence of his sin and uncleanliness.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, giving him these instructions:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel et dices ad eos: Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: “Tell the children of Israel this: I am the Lord, your God.

verses.latin: Juxta consuetudinem Aegypti, in qua habitastis, non facietis: et juxta morem terræ Chanaan, ad quam ego introducturus sum vos, non agetis: nec in legitimis meis ambulabitis.
verses.english: Do not imitate the customs of Egypt, where you once lived. And do not adopt the practices of the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you. You must not follow their traditions and laws.

verses.latin: Mea judicia facietis, et præcepta mea custodietis, et ambulabitis in eis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: Instead, you must obey my judgments. You must keep my commandments and live according to them. I am the Lord, your God.

verses.latin: Custodite legitima mea et judicia mea, quæ faciens homo vivet in illis. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: You must keep my statutes and my judgments. A person who obeys them will truly live and flourish because of them. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Omnis homo ad proximam carnis suæ non accedet, ut revelet turpitudinem ejus. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: No man shall approach any close relative to engage in sexual acts that expose her nakedness. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem patris tui et matris tuæ non revelabis: mater tua est, non revelabis turpitudinem ejus.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father or your mother. She is your mother; you must not expose her nakedness.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem uxoris patris tui non revelabis: turpitudo patris tui est.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife. This would be uncovering your father’s nakedness.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem sororis tuæ ex patre vel matre genitæ, sive domi, sive foris, non revelabis.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your sister, whether she is your father’s daughter or your mother’s daughter, and whether she was born in your home or outside it. You must not do this.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem filiæ filii tui vel filiæ filiæ tuæ non revelabis: quia turpitudo tua est.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter. These are your own nakedness, because they are your direct descendants.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem filiæ uxoris patris tui, quam de patre tuo genuit, et est soror tua, non revelabis.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter—she who was born to your father, who is therefore your sister. You must not do this.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem sororis patris tui non revelabis, quia caro est patris tui.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister. She is your father’s flesh and blood.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem matris uxoris tuæ non revelabis, eo quod caro sit matris tuæ.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother-in-law. She is your wife’s mother, who is like your own mother.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem fratris patris tui non revelabis: nec accedes ad uxorem ejus, quæ tibi affinis est.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother. And you shall not approach his wife to have relations with her, for she is your close relative.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem nurus tuæ non revelabis: quoniam uxor filii tui est, et idcirco non revelabis turpitudinem ejus.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law. She is your son’s wife, and for that reason, you must not uncover her nakedness.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem uxoris fratris tui non revelabis: turpitudo fratris tui est.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife. This would be uncovering your brother’s nakedness.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem uxoris et filiæ ejus non revelabis. Filiam uxoris illius et neptem ex illa non sumes, ut reveletur ignominia ejus: quia caro illius sunt, et prohibitae hujuscemodi copulae.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter. You shall not take her daughter, nor her granddaughter born from that daughter, to uncover their ignominy. They are too closely related to her, and such unions are forbidden.

verses.latin: Sororem uxoris tuæ in pellicatum illius non accipies, nec revelabis turpitudinem ejus, adhuc illa vivente.
verses.english: You shall not take your wife’s sister as a rival wife while your wife is still living, nor uncover her nakedness.

verses.latin: Ad mulierem quæ patitur menstrua, non accedes: nec turpitudinem ejus revelabis.
verses.english: You shall not approach a woman who is in her menstrual period, nor uncover her nakedness while she is in this state.

verses.latin: Cum uxore proximi tui non coibis, nec seminis commixtione maculaberis.
verses.english: You shall not lie with your neighbor’s wife, nor defile yourself with an emission of seed through such mixing.

verses.latin: De semine tuo non dabis, ut consecretur Moloch: nec pollues nomen Dei tui. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: You shall not give any of your offspring to be consecrated to Moloch, nor shall you profane the name of your God. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Cum masculo non commisceberis coitu femineo: abominatio est.
verses.english: You shall not lie with a male as you would with a woman. This is an abomination.

verses.latin: Cum omni pecore non coibis, nec maculaberis. Nec immittet mulier se jumento, ut commisceatur. Abominatio est.
verses.english: You shall not lie with any beast to defile yourself. Nor shall a woman offer herself to a beast to lie with it. This is an abomination.

verses.latin: Ne inquinemini ex omnibus his: cunctis enim sordibus polluta sunt omnes gentes, quas ego ejiciam ante conspectum vestrum,
verses.english: Do not defile yourselves by any of these practices. For it is with all these defilements that the nations—whom I am driving out before you—have polluted themselves.

verses.latin: et polluta est terra, et visitabo scelera ejus, ut evomat habitatores suos.
verses.english: The land itself became defiled. Therefore, I will punish its iniquity, and the land will literally vomit out its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Custodite legitima mea atque judicia, et quicumque de sceleribus his fecerit, peribunt de medio populi sui.
verses.english: You, therefore, must keep my statutes and my judgments. For whoever commits any of these abominations will be cut off from among their people.

verses.latin: Omnes enim abominationes istas fecerunt incolæ terræ, qui fuerunt ante vos, et polluerunt eam.
verses.english: For all these abominations were committed by the inhabitants of the land who were before you, and they thereby polluted the land.

verses.latin: Cavete ergo ne et vos similiter evomat, si quid tale feceritis, sicut evomuit gentem quæ fuit ante vos.
verses.english: Beware, then, that the land does not also vomit you out, if you commit any such thing, just as it has vomited out the nation that was before you.

verses.latin: Omnis anima, quæ fecerit de abominationibus his quippiam, peribit de medio populi sui.
verses.english: Every person who commits any of these abominations will be cut off from among their people.

verses.latin: Custodite mandata mea. Nolite facere de præceptis his, quæ fecerunt hi, qui fuerunt ante vos, et ne polluamini in illis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: Therefore, keep my commands. Do not follow the ordinances of those who were before you in these matters, and do not defile yourselves by them. I am the Lord, your God.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad omnem congregationem filiorum Israël, et dices ad eos: Sancti estote, quoniam ego sanctus sum Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: “Speak to all the assembled people of Israel, and say to them: 'You shall be holy, because I, the Lord your God, am holy.'

verses.latin: Unusquisque matrem suam et patrem suum timeat. Sabbata mea custodite. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'Every one of you shall reverence his mother and his father. You shall keep My Sabbaths. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Nolite converti ad idola, nec deos conflatiles faciatis vobis. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'Do not turn to idols, nor make for yourselves molten gods. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Si immolaveritis hostiam pacificorum Domino, ut accepta sit, sponte offeretis.
verses.english: 'When you offer a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, to be acceptable, you shall offer it willingly.

verses.latin: Eodem die quo fuerit immolata, comedetur, et in crastinum: quidquid residuum fuerit in tertium diem, igne comburetur.
verses.english: 'It shall be eaten on the same day that it is offered, and on the next day. Whatever remains until the third day shall be burned with fire.

verses.latin: Si quis tertio die comederit quidpiam, immunda erit hostia, nec placebit offerenti:
verses.english: 'If anyone eats anything from it on the third day, the sacrifice will be defiled, and it will not please the one who offered it:

verses.latin: portabit iniquitatem suam, eo quod sanctum Domini polluerit: et peribit anima illa de populo suo.
verses.english: 'The person who eats it will bear his guilt, because he has profaned what is holy to the Lord. That soul shall be cut off from his people.

verses.latin: Cum messueritis segetes terræ vestræ, non tondebitis usque ad solum faciem agri vestri: ac reliquos spicarios non colligetis.
verses.english: 'When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not completely clear the corners of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.

verses.latin: Neque in vinea tua racemos et grana decidentia congregabis, sed pauperibus et peregrinis carpenda dimittes. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'Nor shall you gather the fallen grapes from your vineyard or the stray berries. You shall leave them to be gathered by the poor and the stranger. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non furemini. Non mentiamini, neque decipiat unusquisque proximum suum.
verses.english: 'You shall not steal. You shall not lie, nor shall any one of you deceive his neighbor.

verses.latin: Non jurabis in nomine meo mendaciter, nec pollues nomen Dei tui. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall not swear falsely by My Name, nor shall you profane the Name of your God. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Non facies calumniam proximo tuo, nec vi opprimes eum. Non morabitur merces conducti apud te usque mane.
verses.english: 'You shall not defraud your neighbor, nor oppress him by violence. The wages of a hired worker shall not remain with you until morning.

verses.latin: Non maledices surdo, nec coram cæco pones offendiculum: sed timebis Dominum Deum tuum, quia ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind. Instead, you shall fear the Lord your God, because I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Non facietis quod iniquum est in judicio, non respicies personam pauperis, nec honores vultum potentis. Juste judica proximum tuum.
verses.english: 'You shall do no injustice in judgment. You shall not be partial to the poor, nor show deference to the powerful. You shall judge your neighbor justly.

verses.latin: Non eris criminator, nec susurro in populis. Non stabis contra sanguinem proximi tui. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall not go about as a slanderer among your people. You shall not stand by idly while your neighbor's life is at risk. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Non oderis fratrem tuum in corde tuo, sed publice argue eum, ne peccatum portes propter illum.
verses.english: 'You shall not hate your brother in your heart. You shall openly rebuke your neighbor, so that you do not bear sin because of him.

verses.latin: Non quæres ultionem, nec irasceris concivibus tuis. Diliges amicum tuum sicut teipsum. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall not seek revenge, nor harbor anger against your fellow citizens. You shall love your friend as yourself. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Leges meas custodite. Jumenta tua non facies coire cum alterius generis animalibus. Agrum tuum non seres duplici semine. Veste, quæ ex duobus texta est, non indueris.
verses.english: 'You shall keep My statutes. You shall not let your cattle breed with a different kind of animal. You shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed. You shall not wear a garment woven from two different kinds of material.

verses.latin: Si quis dormierit cum muliere coitu seminis, quæ sit ancilla etiam et nupta viro, et tamen non redempta, nec libertate donata, verberibus utrique subjacebunt, et non occidentur, quia non erat libera.
verses.english: 'If a man sleeps with a woman in an act of sexual intercourse, and she is a female slave betrothed to a husband, but has not yet been redeemed or given her freedom, they both shall be punished with scourging; they shall not be put to death, because she was not yet free.

verses.latin: Offeret autem pro delicto suo Domino arietem ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii:
verses.english: 'But for his guilt, he shall bring a ram to the Lord at the entrance of the tabernacle of testimony as an offering.

verses.latin: et orabit pro eo sacerdos coram Domino, pro peccato quod peccavit: et dimittetur ei.
verses.english: 'And the priest shall make atonement for him before the Lord for the sin he has committed, and the sin he committed shall be forgiven him.

verses.latin: Quando ingressi fueritis terram, et plantaveritis in ea ligna pomifera, auferetis præputia eorum: poma quæ germinant, immunda erunt vobis, nec comedentur.
verses.english: 'When you enter the land and plant any fruit-bearing trees, you shall count their fruit as uncircumcised, meaning it is forbidden. For three years, it shall be considered unclean to you; it shall not be eaten.

verses.latin: Quarto autem anno omnis fructus eorum sanctificabitur, laudabilis Domino.
verses.english: 'In the fourth year, all its fruit shall be holy, an offering of praise to the Lord.

verses.latin: Quinto vero anno comedetis fructus, congregantes novissimos foetus. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'But in the fifth year you may eat of its fruit, gathering its produce. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non comedetis cum sanguine. Non ariolabi, nec observabitis somnia.
verses.english: 'You shall not eat anything with blood. You shall not practice divination or observe omens.

verses.latin: Non attondebitis comas ad rotundum, neque radetis barbam.
verses.english: 'You shall not cut the hair on your head in a circular fashion, nor shall you shave off the edges of your beard.

verses.latin: Et super mortuo non incidetis carnem vestram, neque figuras aliquas inurere: Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall not make any cuts on your body for the dead, nor put any tattoo marks on yourselves. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Ne prostituas filiam tuam, et pollue terram, ne impleatur facinus.
verses.english: 'Do not prostitute your daughter, lest the land become defiled and filled with wickedness.

verses.latin: Sabbata mea custodite, et sanctuarium meum metuite. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Non declinetis ad magos, nec ab ariolis aliquid sciscitemini, ut polluamini per eos. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'Do not turn to mediums or spiritists; do not seek them out to be defiled by them. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Coram cano capite consurge, et honora personam senis: et time Dominum Deum tuum. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: 'You shall rise up before the gray head and honor the person of the elderly; and you shall fear the Lord your God. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Si habitet tecum advena in terra vestra, non exprobrabis ei:
verses.english: 'If a stranger lives with you in your land, you shall not oppress him.

verses.latin: sed sit vobis sicut indigena, et diliges eum quasi teipsum: quia et vos fuistis advenæ in terra Ægypti. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: 'But the stranger who lives among you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you too were strangers in the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non facietis iniquum aliquid in judicio, in regula, in pondere, in mensura.
verses.english: 'You shall do no injustice in judgment, in measures of length, in weight, or in liquid measure.

verses.latin: Statera justa et æqua sint pondera, justus modius et æquus sextarius. Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui eduxi vos de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: 'You shall have honest scales, honest weights, an honest dry measure (ephah), and an honest liquid measure (hin). I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Custodite omnia præcepta mea, et universa judicia, et facite ea. Ego Dominus.
