verses.english: 'Therefore, you shall observe all My statutes and all My judgments, and you shall do them. I am the Lord.'

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Filios Israel loquere: Homo de filiis Israel, et de advenis qui peregrinantur apud vos, si quis dederit de semine suo Moloch, morte moriatur: lapidibus eum populus obruet.
verses.english: Speak to the children of Israel: If anyone, whether an Israelite or a foreigner dwelling among you, gives their child to be sacrificed to the idol Moloch, that person must certainly be put to death. The people will stone them with stones.

verses.latin: Et ego ponam faciem meam contra hominem illum, et interficiam eum de medio populi sui, et liberos ejus, qui dedit de semine suo Moloch, polluitque Sanctuarium meum, et nomen meum profanavit sanctum.
verses.english: And I will set My face against that person, and I will cut them off from among their people. I will also cut off their children who were given to Moloch, because they have defiled My Sanctuary and profaned My holy name.

verses.latin: Quod si populus terræ neglexerit, et quasi non viderit, eum qui dederit de semine suo Moloch, nec voluerit occidere:
verses.english: If the people of the land neglect their duty and pretend not to see the one who gives their child to Moloch, and do not put that person to death,

verses.latin: ego ponam faciem meam super hominem illum, et super cognationem ejus, et interficiam eum, et omnes qui consenserunt illi, ut fornicarentur cum Moloch, de medio populi sui.
verses.english: then I will set My face against that person and against their family. And I will cut them off, along with all those who consented to them in their idolatry and spiritual fornication with Moloch, from among their people.

verses.latin: Anima quæ declinaverit ad magos et aruspices, et fornicata fuerit cum eis: ponam faciem meam contra eam, et interficiam illam de medio populi sui.
verses.english: The soul who turns to mediums or diviners, and engages in spiritual fornication with them, I will set My face against that soul and cut them off from among their people.

verses.latin: Sanctificamini, et estote sancti: quia ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: Sanctify yourselves and be holy, because I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Custodite præcepta mea, et facite ea. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico vos.
verses.english: Keep My commandments and do them. I am the Lord who sanctifies you—the One who sets you apart for holiness.

verses.latin: Qui maledixerit patri suo, vel matri, morte moriatur: sanguinem suum portabit, quia patri et matri maledixit.
verses.english: Anyone who curses their father or mother must certainly be put to death. Their blood will be upon them, because they cursed their father and mother.

verses.latin: Si quis adulteraverit cum uxore alterius, et mechatus fuerit cum uxore civis sui, moechus et adultera morte moriantur.
verses.english: If a man commits adultery with the wife of another man, and he engages in illicit sexual relations with his neighbor’s wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress must certainly be put to death.

verses.latin: Qui dormierit cum noverca sua, et turpitudinem patris sui revelaverit, morte moriatur: sanguinem suum portabit.
verses.english: If a man lies with his stepmother and reveals his father’s nakedness (meaning, dishonors his father), he must certainly be put to death. His blood will be upon him.

verses.latin: Si quis dormierit cum nuru sua, ambo morte moriantur: scelus fecerunt: sanguinem suum portabunt.
verses.english: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them must certainly be put to death. They have committed a depraved act. Their blood will be upon them.

verses.latin: Si quis dormierit cum masculo coitu fœmineo, abominandum operatus est: ambo morte moriantur: sanguinem suum super ipsos.
verses.english: If a man lies with a male as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination. Both must certainly be put to death. Their blood will be upon them.

verses.latin: Qui duxerit uxorem, et matrem ejus, scelus operatus est: igne comburetur cum illis, nec sit in medio populi sui.
verses.english: If a man marries a woman and her mother, he has committed a depraved act. He shall be burned with fire along with them, and he will not remain among his people.

verses.latin: Qui coierit cum jumento, morte moriatur: et jumentum occidite.
verses.english: If a man lies with an animal, he must certainly be put to death. And you must also kill the animal.

verses.latin: Mulier quæ subjacerit jumento, et commixta fuerit cum eo, pariter interficietur cum illo: sanguinem suum portabunt.
verses.english: If a woman approaches an animal to lie with it and mixes herself with it, both she and the animal must be put to death. Their blood will be upon them.

verses.latin: Qui acceperit sororem suam, filiam patris sui, aut matris suæ, et viderit turpitudinem ejus, et illa vicissim viderit ignominiam fratris sui, scelus est: nudi in conspectu populi sui interficientur, et portabunt iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: If a man takes his sister, whether his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter, and sees her nakedness (meaning, has sexual relations with her), and she in turn sees his disgrace, it is a depraved act. They shall be put to death naked in the sight of their people, and they will bear the consequence of their iniquity.

verses.latin: Si quis dormierit cum muliere quæ patitur menstrua, et revelaverit turpitudinem ejus, nudaveritque sanguinem suum, ambo de medio populi sui peribunt.
verses.english: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and uncovers her nakedness (meaning, has sexual relations with her) and exposes her menstrual flow, both of them shall perish from among their people.

verses.latin: Turpitudinem sororis matris tuæ, et sororis patris tui non revelabis: qui enim hoc fecerit, ignominiam carnis suæ denudaverit: iniquitatem suam portabunt.
verses.english: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or your father’s sister (meaning, have sexual relations with your aunt), for whoever does this reveals the disgrace of his own flesh. They will bear the consequence of their iniquity.

verses.latin: Qui dormierit cum uxore patrui, vel avunculi sui, et revelaverit ignominiam cognationis suæ, scelus operatus est: iniquitatem suam portabunt, absque liberis morientur.
verses.english: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife (meaning, his aunt by marriage) and reveals the disgrace of his relative, he has committed a depraved act. They will bear the consequence of their iniquity. They will die childless.

verses.latin: Qui acceperit uxorem fratris sui, rem turpem operatus est: ignominiam fratris sui revelavit, absque liberis morietur.
verses.english: If a man takes his brother’s wife, he has committed a disgraceful act. He has revealed his brother’s nakedness (meaning, dishonored his brother). He will die childless.

verses.latin: Custodite leges meas, atque judicia, et estote factores eorum: ne vos evomat terra in quam ingredimini ut habitetis in ea.
verses.english: Keep My statutes and My judgments, and do them, so that the land into which you are entering to dwell may not vomit you out.

verses.latin: Ne ambuletis in legitimis Gentium quas ego ejiciam ante vos. Hæc enim omnia fecerunt, et idcirco abominatus sum eos.
verses.english: Do not walk in the customs of the nations whom I am driving out before you. For they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.

verses.latin: Vobis autem dixi: Possidete terram eorum, et ego dabo vobis eam in hæreditatem, terram fluentem lacte et melle. Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui separavi vos ab aliis populis.
verses.english: But I have said to you: Possess their land, and I will give it to you as an inheritance—a land flowing with milk and honey. I am the Lord your God, who has separated you from other peoples.

verses.latin: Separate ergo et vos animal mundum ab immundo, et avem quæ munda est, ab immunda: ne polluamini carnibus, et jumentis, et avibus, et omnibus quæ reptant in terra, et quæ ostendi vobis esse immunda.
verses.english: Therefore, you must also separate the clean animal from the unclean, and the clean bird from the unclean. Do not defile yourselves with animals, or with birds, or with anything that creeps on the earth, which I have shown you to be unclean.

verses.latin: Estote mihi sancti, quia sanctus sum ego Dominus: et separavi vos a populis ut essetis mei.
verses.english: Be holy to Me, for I am holy, the Lord your God. And I have separated you from the peoples, so that you may be Mine.

verses.latin: Vir, sive mulier, in quibus fuerit spiritus pythonis, aut divinationis, morte moriantur: lapidibus eos obruent: sanguis eorum sit super illos.
verses.english: A man or a woman who has a pythonic spirit (meaning, a spirit of divination or necromancy) or a spirit of sorcery must certainly be put to death. They will be stoned with stones. Their blood will be upon them.

verses.latin: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen: Loquere ad sacerdotes filios Aaron, et dices ad eos: Ne contaminentur in mortibus civium suorum.
verses.english: The Lord God also spoke to Moses, saying: 'Speak to Aaron's sons, who are the priests, and tell them this: They must not make themselves unclean because of a dead body among their own people.'

verses.latin: Nisi tantum in consanguineis et propinquis, id est, juxta se matre, et patre, et filio, et filia, fratre quoque,
verses.english: They may, however, make themselves unclean for a close relative who is their flesh and blood: meaning their mother, father, son, daughter, or brother,

verses.latin: et sorore virgine, quae non est nupta viro.
verses.english: or for their virgin sister who has not yet married.

verses.latin: Non contaminabitur in principe populi sui, nec fiet immundus.
verses.english: A priest must not defile himself on account of a chief man among his people, nor become ritually unclean on that account.

verses.latin: Non radent caput, et barbam, neque in carne sua facient incisuras.
verses.english: They must not shave their heads bald, nor shave the edges of their beards in an unholy way, nor make any cuts on their bodies.

verses.latin: Sancti erunt Domino Deo suo, et non polluent nomen ejus: incensa enim Domini, et panes Dei sui offerunt, et ideo sancti esse debent.
verses.english: They must be holy to the Lord their God, and they must not profane His holy name, because they offer the Lord's sacrifices by fire and the food of their God, and therefore they must be holy.

verses.latin: Non ducent scortum, neque oppressam, nec repudiatam: quia consecrati sunt Deo suo.
verses.english: They must not marry a prostitute, nor a woman who has been defiled by prostitution, nor a woman divorced from her husband: for they are consecrated to their God.

verses.latin: Sanctumque habebis, eo quod offerat panes Dei tui, et mundus erit tibi: quia ego Dominus sanctificator.
verses.english: You must treat him as holy, because he offers the food of your God, and he must be pure to you: for I am the Lord, who sanctifies you.

verses.latin: Sacerdotis filia si deprehensa fuerit in stupro, et nominis patris sui maculaverit sanctitatem, igne comburetur.
verses.english: If a priest's daughter is caught in prostitution, and thereby profanes the holiness of her father's name, she must be burned with fire.

verses.latin: Pontifex maximus inter fratres suos, super cujus caput fusum est unctionis oleum, et cujus manus in sacerdotio consecratae sunt, vestitusque est sanctis vestibus, comam suam non excutiet, et vestimenta sua non scindet.
verses.english: The high priest, who is the greatest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil has been poured, and whose hands have been consecrated for the priesthood, and who is clothed in holy garments, must not uncover his head, nor tear his garments in mourning.

verses.latin: Nec ad quemquam mortuum omnino intrabit: nec super patris aut matris suae cadaver contaminabitur.
verses.english: He must not go near any dead body at all: he must not make himself unclean, even for his own father or mother.

verses.latin: Neque egredietur de sanctis, ne polluat sanctuarium Domini: quia oleum sanctae unctionis Dei sui super eum est. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: He must not leave the holy place of the tabernacle so that he does not profane the Lord's sanctuary: for the oil of the holy anointing of his God is upon him. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Uxorem virginem ducet.
verses.english: He must marry a virgin.

verses.latin: Viduam et repudiatam, et oppressam, atque meretricem non accipiet: sed virginem de populo suo ducet uxorem:
verses.english: He must not marry a widow, or a divorced woman, or a woman who has been defiled by prostitution, or a prostitute: instead, he must marry a virgin from his own people.

verses.latin: ne commisceat stirpem suam inter cognationem, quia ego Dominus sanctificavi eum.
verses.english: so that he does not defile his offspring among his people, because I am the Lord who has sanctified him.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord God also spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Aaron: Homo de semine tuo per familias, qui habuerit in se maculam, non offeret panes Deo suo,
verses.english: Speak to Aaron: No man among your descendants, throughout their generations, who has a blemish or defect in his body, may offer the food of his God,

verses.latin: nec accedet ad ministrandum ei.
verses.english: nor may he approach to minister to Him.

verses.latin: Si quis fuerit caecus, claudus, vel parvo, vel grandi, vel torto naso,
verses.english: If there is any man who is blind, or lame, or who has a small, or a large, or a twisted nose,

verses.latin: gibbus, aut lippus, et albo oculorum colore perfusus fuerit, vel jugem scabiem habens, aut impetiginem in corpore, vel fracturam.
verses.english: or who is a hunchback, or has an eye disease, or who has a white spot over the pupil of his eyes, or who has a chronic skin disease, or ringworm on his body, or a broken limb.

verses.latin: Omnis qui habuerit maculam de semine Aaron, non accedet ad ministrandum Domino, nec offerre dona illi.
verses.english: Anyone among the descendants of Aaron who has such a blemish or defect, must not approach to minister to the Lord, nor to offer gifts to Him.

verses.latin: De pane tamen propositionis, et his quae sanctificata sunt, vesci poterit,
verses.english: However, he may eat from the showbread and from the other holy offerings.

verses.latin: dummodo non intret intra velum, nec accedat ad altare, quia maculam habet, et contaminare non debet sanctuarium meum. Ego Dominus qui sanctifico eos.
verses.english: provided that he does not go inside the veil, nor approach the altar, because he has a blemish or defect, and he must not profane My sanctuary. I am the Lord who sanctifies them.

verses.latin: Haec ergo locutus est Moyses ad Aaron, et filios ejus, et ad omnem Israel.
verses.english: So Moses spoke these words to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Aaron et filios ejus, ut caveant ab his quæ consecrata sunt de filiis Israel, et non contaminent nomen meum quod sanctificatum est mihi, ipse Dominus.
verses.english: Speak to Aaron and his sons, warning them to be careful with the holy offerings that the sons of Israel have consecrated. They must not defile My holy name, which I have sanctified for Myself, for I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Dic ad eos: Homo qui accesserit de omni stirpe vestra ad ea quæ consecrata sunt, et quæ obtulerunt filii Israel Domino, in immunditia sua, peribit de conspectu meo: ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: Say to them: Any man from your priestly lineage who approaches the holy offerings consecrated and presented to the Lord by the sons of Israel, while he is in a state of ritual uncleanness, will be cut off from My presence and face divine punishment. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Homo de stirpe Aaron, si fuerit leprosus, aut tabidus, non comedet de his quæ sanctificata sunt mihi, donec mundetur. Qui tetigerit immundum super animam, vel fluxum seminis habuerit,
verses.english: No man from the lineage of Aaron, if he has leprosy or a discharge, is to eat from the things that have been sanctified for Me, until he becomes ritually clean. Likewise, anyone who touches a person unclean due to a dead body or who has a seminal emission,

verses.latin: et qui reptili tactus fuerit quo polluitur, aut homine cujus tactu et ipse factus fuerit immundus, immundus erit usque ad vesperum:
verses.english: or who touches any creeping thing by which he becomes defiled, or a man by whose touch he himself becomes unclean—that person will be unclean until evening.

verses.latin: et non comedet de his quæ sanctificata sunt: sed cum laverit carnem suam aqua,
verses.english: He must not eat from the holy offerings until he has purified himself. Instead, he must wash his body with water.

verses.latin: et occidente sole mundus erit, et tunc comedet de his quæ sanctificata sunt: quia cibus illius est.
verses.english: When the sun has set, he will be clean. After that, he may eat from the holy offerings, because these are his priestly food.

verses.latin: Morticinum et captum a bestia non comedent, ne polluantur in illis. Ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: They—meaning the priests—must not eat any animal that has died a natural death or that has been torn by wild beasts, so that they do not become defiled by eating such things. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Custodiant præcepta mea, ut non peccent, et moriantur in sanctuario, cum polluerint illud. Ego Dominus sanctificator eorum.
verses.english: They must keep My commands, so that they do not sin and die in the sanctuary, by defiling it. I am the Lord, who sanctifies them, setting them apart for My service.

verses.latin: Omnis alienigena non comedet de sanctificatis, et inquilinus sacerdotis et mercenarius non vescentur ex eis.
verses.english: No unauthorized person, meaning anyone not from the priestly lineage, is to eat from the holy offerings. A guest living with the priest, or a hired servant, must not eat of them.

verses.latin: Quem autem sacerdos emerit, et fuerit de familia ejus, hic comedet ex eis. Servique ejus qui domi fuerint nati, his vescentur alimento suo.
verses.english: However, if a priest purchases a servant as property, that servant is part of his household and may eat from the holy offerings. And those who are born into his household, his own domestic servants, may also eat of his priestly food.

verses.latin: Si filia sacerdotis cuipiam laico nupta fuerit, de his quæ sanctificata sunt, et de primitiis non comedet.
verses.english: If a priest's daughter marries an unauthorized layman, she must not eat from the holy offerings or the firstfruits—these are reserved for the priestly family.

verses.latin: Sin autem vidua, vel repudiata, et absque liberis reversa fuerit ad domum patris sui sicut puella, de cibis patris sui vivet: alienigena vero non comedet ex eis.
verses.english: But if a priest's daughter becomes a widow or is divorced, and has no children, and she returns to her father's household just as she was before her marriage, she may again eat of her father's priestly food. However, no unauthorized person is permitted to eat from these offerings.

verses.latin: Qui comederit de sanctificatis per ignorantiam, addet quintam partem cum eo quod comedit, et dabit sacerdoti.
verses.english: If someone, through inadvertent error, eats from the holy offerings, he must add a fifth of its value to what he ate and give it to the priest as restitution.

verses.latin: Et non contaminabunt quæ sanctificata sunt a filiis Israel, et oblata Domino:
verses.english: And the sons of Israel must not defile the holy offerings consecrated and presented to the Lord,

verses.latin: ne forte sustineant iniquitatem delicti sui, cum sanctificata comederint. Ego Dominus sanctificator eorum.
verses.english: lest they bear the guilt of their sin when they eat those holy things while in a state of impurity. I am the Lord, who sanctifies them.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere ad Aaron et ad filios ejus, et ad omnes filios Israel, dices ad eos: Homo de domo Israel, et de proselytis qui advenæ sunt in Israel, qui obtulerit oblationem suam, vel vota solvens, vel sponte offerens, quidquid illud fuerit ut offerri debeat Domino in holocaustum,
verses.english: Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the sons of Israel, saying to them: If any man from the house of Israel, or from the resident foreigners among Israel, offers his gift—whether to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering—whatever it may be that is to be offered to the Lord as a burnt offering,

verses.latin: ut offeratur placabile, immaculatum masculum, de bobus, et de ovibus, et de capris.
verses.english: for it to be accepted and pleasing to God, it must be an unblemished male from the cattle, sheep, or goats.

verses.latin: Quidquid maculatum fuerit, non offeretis: quia non erit vobis in placamentum.
verses.english: You must not offer anything that has a blemish or defect, because such an offering will not be accepted as an atonement for you.

verses.latin: Homo qui obtulerit victimam pacificorum Domino, vel vota solvens, vel sponte offerens, tam de bobus quam de ovibus, immaculatum offeret ut acceptabile sit: omne vitium non erit in eo.
verses.english: If a man offers a peace offering to the Lord, whether to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering, from either cattle or sheep, he must offer it unblemished so that it may be acceptable to God. There must be no defect in it whatsoever.

verses.latin: Si cæcum, si fractum, si cicatricem habens, si verrucosum, vel scabiosum, vel impetiginosum fuerit, non offeretis ea Domino, nec de eis dabitis ignis sacrificium super altare Domini.
verses.english: You must not offer to the Lord any animal that is blind, or has a broken limb, or a wound, or is afflicted with warts, or is scabby, or has mange. You must not present any of these with a fire offering upon the Lord's altar.

verses.latin: Bovem et ovem, si quid decurtatum vel deminutum habuerit, sponte offerre potes: votum autem ex his solvi non potest.
verses.english: You may offer a bull or a lamb that has a limb too long or too short as a freewill offering. However, it cannot be accepted to fulfill a vow, as it is not perfect.

verses.latin: Omne animal quod vel contritis, vel atteritur, vel sectis, vel ablatis testiculis fuerit, non offeretis Domino: et in terra vestra nihil horum facietis.
verses.english: You must not offer to the Lord any animal whose testicles are crushed, bruised, torn, or cut off. You must not do any of these things within your land, meaning you should not mutilate animals in this way for offerings.

verses.latin: De manu aliena non offeretis panes Dei vestri, et quidquid aliud dare volueritis: quia corrupta sunt omnia, et maculata: nec recipientur ab eo.
verses.english: You must not accept such offerings, meaning blemished animals, from the hand of a foreigner to present as food offerings to your God, or for any other purpose you intend to give to Him. This is because all such animals are corrupt and blemished, and therefore they will not be accepted by God.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Bos, ovis, et capra, cum genita fuerint, septem diebus erunt sub ubere matris suæ: die octavo et deinceps, offerri potuerunt Domino.
verses.english: When a bull, a sheep, or a goat is born, it must remain with its mother for seven days. From the eighth day onward, it may be offered to the Lord as an acceptable sacrifice.

verses.latin: Sive bos, sive ovis, cum fœtu suo unius diei spatio non immolabuntur.
verses.english: Whether it is a cow or a ewe, you must not slaughter it and its offspring on the same day.

verses.latin: Si immolaveritis hostiam pro gratiarum actione Domino, ut placere possitis, sponte offeretis.
verses.english: If you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the Lord, so that you may be pleasing to Him, you must offer it voluntarily and sincerely.

verses.latin: Eodem die comedetis, nec remanebit quidquam in mane alterius diei. Ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: You must eat it on the same day it is offered. Nothing of it is to remain until the morning of the next day. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Custodite mandata mea, et facite ea. Ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: Keep My commandments and perform them exactly as I have instructed. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Ne polluatis nomen meum sanctum, ut sanctificer in medio filiorum Israel. Ego Dominus, qui sanctifico vos,
verses.english: You must not profane My holy name, so that I may be sanctified and honored among the sons of Israel. I am the Lord, who sanctifies you and sets you apart.

verses.latin: qui eduxi vos de terra Ægypti, ut essem vester Deus. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God and your protector. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Feriae Domini, quas celebre in temporibus suis, hae sunt.
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: These are the Lord's solemn feasts, which you shall celebrate in their appointed times.

verses.latin: Sex diebus facietis opus: septimus dies sabbati est, requies sancta, nullum facietis in eo opus: sabbatum Domini est in cunctis habitationibus vestris.
verses.english: Six days you shall do work. But the seventh day is the Sabbath, a holy rest; you shall do no work on it. It is the Lord's Sabbath throughout all your dwellings.

verses.latin: Hae sunt ergo celebrationes Domini sanctissimae, quas celebrabitis in temporibus suis.
verses.english: These then are the Lord's most holy celebrations, which you shall observe in their seasons.

verses.latin: Mense primo, quartadecima die mensis, ad vesperum Phase Domini est.
verses.english: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, is the Lord's Passover.

verses.latin: Et quintadecima die mensis hujus, solemnitas Azymorum Domini est: septem diebus azyma comedetis.
verses.english: And on the fifteenth day of this same month, is the Lord's solemn feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days, you shall eat unleavened bread.

verses.latin: Dies primus celeberrimus erit vobis, nullumque opus servile facietis in eo:
verses.english: The first day shall be a most solemn assembly for you, and you shall do no servile work on it.

verses.latin: sed offeretis incensum Domino septem diebus. Diesque septimus venerabilis erit, nullumque opus servile facietis in eo.
verses.english: But you shall offer burnt offerings by fire to the Lord for seven days. And the seventh day shall be held in veneration, and you shall do no servile work on it.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram quam ego dabo vobis, et messueritis segetes, feretis manipulos spicarum, primitias messis vestrae, ad sacerdotem:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: When you have entered the land which I will give you, and you have reaped its harvest, you shall bring sheaves of grain, the firstfruits of your harvest, to the priest.

verses.latin: qui elevabit fasciculum coram Domino, ut acceptus sit vobis, altero die sabbati, atque sanctificabit illum.
verses.english: He shall wave the sheaf before the Lord, that it may be accepted for you, on the day after the Sabbath, and he shall consecrate it.

verses.latin: Et in die qua levatur manipulus, immolabit agnum anniculum immaculatum in holocaustum Domino.
verses.english: And on the day when the sheaf is waved, you shall offer a spotless year-old lamb as a burnt offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et sacrificia ejus, duas decimas similae conspersae oleo, in incensum Domini, et odorem suavissimum: libamenta quoque ejus, vinum quartam partem hin.
verses.english: And its accompanying sacrifices shall be two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil, as a burnt offering by fire to the Lord, for a most sweet aroma. Its libations also shall be wine, a fourth part of a hin.

verses.latin: Panem et tostum, et pulmentum vetus non comedetis ex segetibus, donec offeratis de his aliquid Deo vestro. Praeceptum est sempiternum in generationibus vestris cunctis, et in omnibus habitationibus vestris.
verses.english: You shall not eat bread, nor parched grain, nor any old produce from your harvest, until you have offered something of these to your God. This is an everlasting commandment throughout all your generations and in all your dwellings.”

verses.latin: Numerabitis ergo vobis ab altero die sabbati, in quo obtulistis manipulum spicarum primitiarum, septem hebdomadas plenas,
verses.english: “Therefore, you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, on which you brought the sheaf of the firstfruits, seven full weeks.

verses.latin: usque ad alteram diem expletionis hebdomadae septimae, id est, quinquaginta dies: et sic offeretis sacrificium novum Domino.
verses.english: You shall count until the day after the completion of the seventh week—that is, fifty days. And then you shall offer a new sacrifice to the Lord.

verses.latin: De omnibus habitationibus vestris, panes primos in primitias Domino, duos panes de duabus decimis similae conspersos fermento, quos coquetis.
verses.english: From all your dwellings, you shall bring two loaves of bread as firstfruits to the Lord, two loaves made of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour, baked with leaven, which you shall bake yourselves.

verses.latin: Offeretisque cum panibus septem agnos immaculatos anniculos, et bovem de armentis, et duos arietes: eruntque in holocaustum cum sacrificiis suis et libamentis suis, in odorem suavissimum Domino.
verses.english: And with the bread, you shall offer seven spotless year-old lambs, and one bull from the herd, and two rams. These shall be a burnt offering, with their accompanying sacrifices and libations, for a most sweet aroma to the Lord.

verses.latin: Facietisque hircum pro peccato, et duos agnos anniculos in sacrificium pacificorum.
verses.english: You shall also offer one male goat as a sin offering, and two year-old lambs as sacrifices of peace offerings.

verses.latin: Cumque elevaverit sacerdos panes cum agnis coram Domino, sanctificata erunt sacerdotis,
verses.english: When the priest has waved the bread with the lambs before the Lord, they shall be consecrated to the priest.

verses.latin: et spectabunt ad eum. Vocabitque et annuntiabit hac ipsa die celeberrimam et sanctissimam concionem: omne opus servile non facietis in ea. Legitimum sempiternum erit in cunctis habitationibus vestris, et in generationibus vestris.
verses.english: And they shall belong to him. He shall also proclaim and announce on this very day a most solemn and holy convocation. You shall do no servile work on it. This shall be an everlasting statute throughout all your dwellings and in your generations.”

verses.latin: Cum messueritis segetes terrae vestrae, non quasi usque ad solum metes, nec remanentes spicas colliges: sed pauperibus et peregrinis relinques eas. Ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: “When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap to the very edge of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest. Instead, you shall leave them for the poor and for the strangers. I am the Lord your God.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel: Mense septimo, prima die mensis, sabbatum erit vobis, solemnitas memorabilis, clangentibus tubis, et conventus sanctus.
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a Sabbath—a solemn feast of remembrance, announced by the blowing of trumpets—and a holy convocation.

verses.latin: Omne opus servile non facietis in eo: et offeretis holocaustum Domino.
verses.english: You shall do no servile work on it, and you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Decima die mensis hujus septimi, dies expiationum est celeberrimus, et vocabitur sanctus: affligetisque animas vestras in eo, et offeretis holocaustum Domino.
verses.english: “On the tenth day of this seventh month, there shall be the most solemn Day of Atonement, and it shall be called holy. You shall afflict your souls on it, and you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Omne opus non facietis in die hoc, quia dies propitiationis est, ut propitietur vobis Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: You shall do no work on this day, for it is the Day of Propitiation, so that the Lord your God may make propitiation for you.

verses.latin: Omnis anima quae afflicta non fuerit in die hoc, peribit de populis suis:
verses.english: Every soul who has not afflicted himself on this day shall perish from among his people.

verses.latin: et quae fecerit quidquam, delebo eam de medio populi sui.
verses.english: And whoever does any work, I will destroy that soul from among his people.

verses.latin: Omne opus non facietis: legitimum sempiternum erit vobis in cunctis generationibus vestris, et habitationibus.
verses.english: You shall do no work. This shall be an everlasting statute for you throughout all your generations and dwellings.

verses.latin: Sabbati requies est ab vespera usque ad vesperam: celebrabitis sabbata vestra.
verses.english: It is a Sabbath of rest from evening until evening. You shall celebrate your Sabbaths.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices: A quintadecima die mensis hujus septimi, solemnitas tabernaculorum septem diebus Domino.
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: From the fifteenth day of this seventh month, for seven days, there shall be the solemn Feast of Tabernacles to the Lord.

verses.latin: Dies primus celeberrimus et sanctissimus erit: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.
verses.english: The first day shall be a most solemn and holy assembly. You shall do no servile work on it.

verses.latin: Septem diebus offeretis holocaustum Domino: et in die octavo erit celeberrima atque sanctissima concio, offeretisque holocaustum Domino: est enim dies continuationis, atque congregationis: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.
verses.english: For seven days you shall offer burnt offerings to the Lord. And on the eighth day, there shall be a most solemn and holy convocation, and you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord. For it is a day of conclusion and assembly, and you shall do no servile work on it.

verses.latin: Hae sunt festivitates Domini, quas celebrabitis sanctissimis conventibus, atque offeretis in eis oblationes Domino, holocaustum et sacrificium, libamenta et victimas, singula in diebus suis:
verses.english: These are the Lord's festivals, which you shall celebrate with most holy convocations, and in them you shall offer oblations to the Lord: burnt offerings and sacrifices, libations and victims, each on its proper day.

verses.latin: absque sabbatis Domini, et muneribus vestris, et cunctis quae ex voto vel sponte offertis Domino.
verses.english: These are in addition to the Lord's Sabbaths, and your gifts, and all that you offer to the Lord by vow or by freewill.

verses.latin: A quintodecimo ergo die mensis septimi, quando congregaveritis omnes fructus terrae vestrae, celebrabitis solemnitatem Domini septem diebus: die primo et die octavo, sabbatum erit, id est, requies.
verses.english: Therefore, from the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered all the produce of your land, you shall celebrate the Lord's solemn feast for seven days. On the first day and on the eighth day, there shall be a Sabbath—that is, a day of rest.

verses.latin: Tolletisque vobis die primo, fructus arboris pulcherrimae, et palmarum frondes, et ramos ligni densarum frondium, et salices de torrente, et laetabimini coram Domino Deo vestro septem diebus.
verses.english: And on the first day, you shall take for yourselves the fruit of a beautiful tree, and branches of palm trees, and boughs of thick-leaved trees, and willows from the brook, and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God for seven days.”

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Praecipe filiis Israel ut afferant tibi oleum de olivis purissimum atque lucidissimum, ad concinnandas lucernas jugiter,
verses.english: "Command the children of Israel to bring you the purest and clearest olive oil, so that the lamps can be kept lit continually.

verses.latin: extra velum testimonii in tabernaculo foederis, ut ardeat semper a vespere usque mane coram Domino, ritu perpetuo in generationibus vestris.
verses.english: This is to be done outside the veil of testimony, within the tabernacle of the covenant. The lamps must burn from evening until morning before the Lord without fail, an everlasting law for all your descendants.

verses.latin: Super candelabrum purissimum, in conspectu Domini, semper concinnabuntur.
verses.english: The lamps upon the lampstand, which is made of pure gold, must always be kept trimmed and burning before the Lord's presence.

verses.latin: Accipies quoque similam, et coques ex ea duodecim panes, qui singuli duas decimas similae habebunt.
verses.english: You shall also take fine flour and bake twelve loaves from it, each loaf made with two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour.

verses.latin: Et pones eos, bis sex, per duos ordines, super mensam purissimam coram Domino.
verses.english: You shall place them, in two stacks of six loaves each, upon the table of pure gold before the Lord.

verses.latin: Ponesque super utrumque ordinem tus lucidissimum, ut sit panis in monumentum oblationis Domini.
verses.english: You shall place pure frankincense upon each stack, so that the bread may serve as a memorial portion, an offering to the Lord.

verses.latin: Omni sabbato mutabuntur coram Domino, accepti a filiis Israel foedere sempiterno.
verses.english: These loaves shall be changed out every Sabbath before the Lord, received from the children of Israel as an everlasting covenant.

verses.latin: Eruntque Aaron et filiorum ejus, ut comedant illos in loco sanctissimo: quia sanctum sanctorum est de oblationibus Domini, jure perpetuo.
verses.english: And these loaves shall be for Aaron and his sons to eat in a most holy place, because they are a most holy portion from the Lord's offerings, belonging to them by an everlasting right.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem filius mulieris Israelitidis, quem pepererat de viro Aegyptio inter filios Israel: et jurgatus est in castris cum viro Israelite.
verses.english: Now, the son of an Israelite woman—who had an Egyptian father—came out among the children of Israel. This man got into a quarrel in the camp with another Israelite.

verses.latin: Et blasphemavit nomen Domini, et maledixit ei. Quam ob causam adductus est ad Moysen.
verses.english: And this man blasphemed the Lord's Name and cursed Him. Because of this, he was brought to Moses.

verses.latin: Mater autem illius vocabatur Salumith, filia Dabri de tribu Dan.
verses.english: His mother's name was Shelomith, daughter of Dibri, from the tribe of Dan.

verses.latin: Posueruntque eum in carcere, donec scirent quid juberet Dominus.
verses.english: They put him in custody until they could learn what the Lord's command would be concerning him.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Educ blasphemum extra castra: et ponant omnes qui audierant, manus suas super caput ejus: et lapidet eum coetus omnis filiorum Israel.
verses.english: "Take the one who blasphemed outside the camp. Let all who heard his blasphemy lay their hands upon his head as witnesses. Then, let the entire congregation of the children of Israel stone him to death."

verses.latin: Et ad filios Israel loqueris: Homo qui maledixerit Deo suo, portabit peccatum suum.
verses.english: And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: 'Whoever curses his God shall bear the full consequence for his sin.'

verses.latin: Et qui percusserit et occiderit hominem, morte moriatur.
verses.english: And whoever strikes and kills any person must be put to death.

verses.latin: Qui percusserit animal, reddat vicarium, id est, animam pro anima.
verses.english: Whoever strikes and kills an animal must make restitution, paying back life for life.

verses.latin: Si quis foederet proximum suum, sicut fecit, ita fiet ei:
verses.english: If anyone injures his neighbor, as he has done, so shall it be done to him:

verses.latin: fractura pro fractura, oculum pro oculo, dentem pro dente restituet. Qualem inflixerit maculam, talem sustinere cogetur.
verses.english: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. Whatever injury or blemish he inflicted, such shall he be compelled to suffer.

verses.latin: Qui percusserit et occiderit hominem, occidetur. Qui vulneraverit jumentum, restituet.
verses.english: Whoever strikes and kills a human being shall be put to death. But whoever wounds or kills an animal shall make restitution for it.

verses.latin: Eadem erit lex vobis, sive peregrinus ille, sive civis peccaverit: quia ego Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: You shall have the same law for both the foreigner and the native-born person who has sinned, because I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses ad filios Israel: et eduxerunt eum qui blasphemaverat, extra castra, atque lapidaverunt. Feceruntque filii Israel sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: So Moses spoke to the children of Israel. They led the blasphemer outside the camp and stoned him to death. The children of Israel did exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in monte Sinai, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Moses while he was on Mount Sinai, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis terram quam ego dabo vobis, colenda erit sabbata Domini.
verses.english:
Say this to the people of Israel:
“When you enter the land that I am giving you, the land itself must also keep a Sabbath rest for the Lord.

verses.latin: Sex annis seres agrum tuum, et sex annis putabis vineam tuam, et congregabis fructus ejus:
verses.english: For six years, you may sow your fields and prune your vineyards, and gather their produce.

verses.latin: septimo autem anno sabbatum erit terrae, requies et sabbatum Domini: agrum tuum non seres, et vineam tuam non putabis.
verses.english:
But during the seventh year, the land itself must have a full rest, a Sabbath for the Lord.
You must not sow your field or prune your vineyard during that year.

verses.latin: Quæ sponte germinaverint, non metes: et uvas, absque cura culturæ nascentium, non colliges quasi vindemiam: requies enim sanctificationis est terræ.
verses.english:
Do not harvest whatever grows naturally from your previous crop, and do not gather the grapes from your unpruned vines, even those that bear fruit on their own.
It is a year of holy rest for the land.

verses.latin: Sed erunt vobis cuncta communia, in cibum tibi et servis tuis, et ancillis atque mercenariis tuis, et advenæ qui peregrinantur apud te.
verses.english: But whatever the land yields during its Sabbath rest will be food for you—for yourself and your servants, your male and female slaves, your hired workers, and any foreign residents who live with you.

verses.latin: Jumentis quoque et animalibus tuis, omne quod nascitur, in pabulum erit.
verses.english: All the produce of the land during that year will also be food for your livestock and for all the wild animals that are in your land.”

verses.latin: Numerabis quoque tibi septem hebdomadas annorum, id est, septem et septem vicibus annos quinquaginta:
verses.english:
Then you must count seven Sabbath years—seven times seven years.
This totals forty-nine years.

verses.latin: et sanctificabis annum quinquagesimum, præconio jubilei in omni terra vestra ad omnes habitatores ejus: ipse est enim jubileus.
verses.english:
On the tenth day of the seventh month, on the Day of Atonement, you must sound the ram’s horn loudly throughout all your land.
This will mark the fiftieth year as a holy year for you.
You must proclaim liberation throughout the land for all its inhabitants.
This year will be the Jubilee for you.

verses.latin: Jubileus et quinquagesimus annus erit vobis: non seretis, neque metetis sponte nata, neque colligetis primitias de his quæ non sunt culta.
verses.english:
The fiftieth year will be a Jubilee for you.
You must not sow, nor reap what grows of itself, nor gather grapes from the unpruned vines.

verses.latin: Quia jubileus est, et sanctificatus erit vobis: de campis statim comedetis.
verses.english: Because it is the Jubilee, it will be holy to you; you will eat what the fields produce naturally.

verses.latin: In anno jubilæi revertetur unusquisque ad possessionem suam.
verses.english: In this year of Jubilee, every person must return to their family property and to their ancestral clan.

verses.latin: Si quid vendideris civi tuo, aut emeris ab eo, non contristabitis invicem, sed juxta numerum annorum jubilei emes a proximo tuo:
verses.english:
When you make a sale to your neighbor or buy anything from him, you must not cheat one another.
The price of the land will depend on the number of years remaining until the next Jubilee.

verses.latin: et juxta supputationem frugum vendet tibi.
verses.english: You will buy from your neighbor according to the number of harvests remaining before the Jubilee.

verses.latin: Quanto plures anni remanserint post jubilæum, tanto et major erit pretii æstimatio: et quanto minus temporis numeraveris, tanto minor et emptio erit: tempus enim frugum vendit tibi.
verses.english:
If there are many years left until the Jubilee, you will increase the price; if there are only a few years left, you will reduce the price.
It is the number of harvests, not the land itself, that he is selling to you.

verses.latin: Non affliget vos invicem, sed timebit unusquisque Deum suum: quia ego sum Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english:
You must not oppress one another.
Instead, you must fear your God, because I am the Lord God, your God.

verses.latin: Facite præcepta mea, et judicia mea custodite, et implete ea: et habitabitis in terra absque ullo metu.
verses.english:
You must follow My statutes and keep My ordinances and obey them.
Then you will live securely in the land, without any fear.

verses.latin: Et dabit terra fructus suos, et comedetis in saturitatem, et habitabitis in ea absque formidine.
verses.english: The land will yield its produce, and you will eat your fill, and you will dwell in it without dread.

verses.latin: Quod si dixeritis: Quid comedemus anno septimo, si non seruerimus, neque collegerimus fruges nostras?
verses.english: If you ask, “What will we eat in the seventh year if we do not sow or gather our produce?”

verses.latin: Dabo vobis benedictionem meam anno sexto, et faciet fructus trium annorum:
verses.english: I will send My blessing on you in the sixth year, and it will produce enough grain for three years.

verses.latin: et seretis octavo anno, et comedetis veteres fruges usque ad nonum annum: donec nova germinentur, comedetis vetera.
verses.english: So you will sow in the eighth year, but you will still be eating from the old produce until the ninth year, until the new harvest comes in.

verses.latin: Terra quoque non vendetur in perpetuum, quia mea est, et vos advenæ et coloni mei estis.
verses.english: The land must not be sold permanently, because the land is Mine, and you are merely My temporary residents and tenants.

verses.latin: Propter hoc omnis regio possessionis vestræ sub redemptione vendetur.
verses.english: Therefore, for all the land of your possession, you must provide for the right of redemption when it is sold.

verses.latin: Si frater tuus paupertate detentus vendiderit possessiunculam suam, et voluerit propinquus ejus, potest redimere quod ille vendiderat.
verses.english: If your kinsman, a fellow Israelite, becomes poor and sells some of his family property, then his nearest relative who can redeem it must come and buy back what his kinsman sold.

verses.latin: Sin autem non habuerit qui redimat, et ipse postea potuerit, et invenerit pretium ad redemptionem:
verses.english: If a man has no one to redeem it for him, but he himself later acquires sufficient means to redeem it,

verses.latin: supputatis fructibus eorum qui venditi fuerant, residuum reddet emptori, et sic revertetur ad possessionem suam.
verses.english:
then he must calculate the years since the sale, deduct the value of the produce taken by the buyer, and repay the remainder to the man who bought it.
Then the property will return to him.

verses.latin: Quod si non invenerit manus ejus ut reddat pretium, quicumque emerat, habebit quod emerat, usque ad annum jubileum: in jubileo enim omnis venditio redit ad dominum et ad pristinum possessorem.
verses.english:
But if he cannot afford to buy it back, then what he sold will remain in the possession of the buyer until the Year of Jubilee.
In the Jubilee, it will be released, and the property will revert to the original owner.

verses.latin: Qui vendiderit domum intra muros civitatis, habebit licentiam redimendi, donec anni circulus impleatur.
verses.english: If someone sells a dwelling house inside a walled city, he retains the right to redeem it for a full year after the sale.

verses.latin: Si non redemerit, et anni circulus impletus fuerit, emptor possidebit eam, et posteri ejus in perpetuum, et non redibit in jubileo.
verses.english:
If it is not redeemed within a full year, then the house within the walled city will belong permanently to the buyer and his descendants.
It will not revert to the original owner in the Jubilee.

verses.latin: Si vero domus fuerit in villis quæ muros non habent, agrorum jure vendentur: et redimi a quocumque voluerit, poterunt: et in jubileo revertentur ad dominos.
verses.english:
But houses in unwalled villages must be treated as open country.
They may be redeemed at any time, and they will revert to the original owner in the Jubilee.

verses.latin: Levitarum domus quæ sunt in urbibus, semper redimi poterunt.
verses.english: However, the houses in the Levitical cities, which are designated cities for the Levites, may always be redeemed by the Levites.

verses.latin: Si et a Levitis fuerint venditæ, in jubileo revertentur: quia domus civitatum Leviticarum, ipsæ sunt possessiones eorum in medio filiorum Israel.
verses.english: If a Levite sells a house in a Levitical city, it will revert to him in the Jubilee, because the houses in the Levitical cities are their perpetual possession among the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Et suburbana eorum non venient: quia perpetua possessio est.
verses.english: The pasturelands around their cities, however, cannot be sold, because they are their permanent possession for all time.

verses.latin: Si attenuatus fuerit frater tuus, et tenuerit apud te manus suas, suscipies eum quasi advenam et peregrinum, et vivet tecum.
verses.english: If your kinsman, a fellow Israelite, becomes poor and unable to support himself, you must help him, just as you would help a foreign resident or a temporary settler, so that he can live among you.

verses.latin: Non accipies usuras ab eo, nec amplius quam dedisti: timebis Dominum Deum tuum, ut possit frater tuus vivere tecum.
verses.english:
Do not charge him interest on the money you lend him, or take any profit from him.
Instead, you must fear your God, so that your kinsman can continue to live alongside you.

verses.latin: Pecuniam tuam non dabis ad usuram, et ad superabundantiam non exiges fruges.
verses.english: You must not lend him money at interest, nor sell him food for profit.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui eduxi vos de terra Ægypti, ut darem vobis terram Chanaan, et essem vester Deus.
verses.english: I am the Lord God, your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.

verses.latin: Si vendiderit se tibi frater tuus, aut civis tuus, et servierit tibi, non eum opprimes servitute famulorum:
verses.english: If your kinsman, a fellow Israelite, becomes poor and sells himself to you, you must not make him serve as a common slave.

verses.latin: sed quasi mercenarius et colonus erit apud te usque ad annum jubilæum.
verses.english: He must be treated like a hired worker or a temporary resident among you; he will serve you only until the Year of Jubilee.

verses.latin: Et tunc egredietur a te cum liberis suis, et revertetur ad cognationem suam, et ad possessionem patrum suorum.
verses.english: Then he and his children with him will be released from you, and he will return to his family and to the family property of his ancestors.

verses.latin: Non facietis vobis idolum, et sculptile, nec titulos erigetis, nec insignem lapidem ponetis in terra vestra, ut adoretis eum: ego enim sum Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: You shall not make idols for yourselves, nor set up any carved images or sacred pillars, nor place any notable stone in your land for the purpose of worshiping it. For I am the Lord, your God.

verses.latin: Mea sabbata custodite, et sanctuarium meum metuite. Ego Dominus.
verses.english: Keep my Sabbaths and revere my sanctuary. I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Si in præceptis meis ambulaveritis, et mandata mea custodieritis, et feceritis ea,
verses.english: If you live according to my commands, and carefully obey my commandments, putting them into practice,

verses.latin: dabo vobis pluviam temporibus suis, et terra gignet germen suum, et pomis arbores replebuntur.
verses.english: then I will give you rain at the proper times, and the land will produce its crops, and the trees will be filled with fruit.

verses.latin: Apprehendet tritura messis, et vindemia occupabit sementem: et comedetis panem vestrum in saturitate, et absque terrore habitabitis in terra vestra.
verses.english: Your threshing season will last until the harvest time, and your grape harvest will extend until planting time. You will eat your fill of bread, and you will live securely in your land, without fear.

verses.latin: Dabo pacem in finibus vestris: dormietis, et non erit qui exterreat. Auferam malas bestias, et gladius non transibit fines vestros.
verses.english: I will bring peace to your land; you will sleep soundly, and no one will make you afraid. I will remove dangerous animals, and no army will invade your land.

verses.latin: Persequemini inimicos vestros, et corruent coram vobis.
verses.english: You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall before you.

verses.latin: Persequentur quinque de vestris centum alienos, et centum de vobis decem millia: cadetque inimicus vester in conspectu vestro gladio.
verses.english: Five of you will put one hundred of your enemies to flight, and one hundred of you will put ten thousand to flight. And your enemies will fall before you by the sword.

verses.latin: Respiciam vos, et crescere faciam: multiplicabimini, et firmabo pactum meum vobiscum.
verses.english: I will look favorably upon you and I will make you fruitful; you will multiply greatly, and I will confirm my covenant with you.

verses.latin: Comedetis vetustissima veterum, et vetera novis supervenientibus projicietis.
verses.english: You will still be eating from last year's plentiful harvest when you must clear space for the new harvest.

verses.latin: Ponam tabernaculum meum in medio vestri, et non abjiciet vos anima mea.
verses.english: I will set my tabernacle among you, and my soul will not reject you.

verses.latin: Ambulabo in medio vestri, et ero vester Deus, vosque eritis populus meus.
verses.english: I will walk among you, and I will be your God, and you will be my people.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus Deus vester, qui eduxi vos de terra Ægypti, ne serviretis illis, qui confregi catenas cervicum vestrarum, et incedere feci eréctos.
verses.english: I am the Lord your God, who led you out of the land of Egypt so that you would not be slaves to them. I who broke the yoke of your slavery from your necks and made you walk with your heads held high.

verses.latin: Si autem non audieritis me, nec feceritis omnia mandata mea,
verses.english: But if you will not listen to me, nor do all my commandments,

verses.latin: si spretis legibus meis, et judiciis meis contempseritis, ut non faciatis ea quæ a me constituta sunt, et irritum faciatis pactum meum:
verses.english: if you despise my laws and scorn my judgments by refusing to do what I have commanded, and thereby break my covenant:

verses.latin: ego quoque hæc faciam vobis: visitabo vos velociter in egestate, et ardore, qui conficiat oculos vestros, et consumat animas vestras. Frustra seretis sementem, quæ ab hostibus devorabitur.
verses.english: I, in turn, will do this to you: I will swiftly punish you with misery and with a burning fever that will dim your eyes and waste away your lives. You will sow your seed in vain, because your enemies will devour it.

verses.latin: Ponam faciem meam contra vos, et corruetis coram hostibus vestris, et subjiciemini his qui oderunt vos: fugietis, nemine persequente.
verses.english: I will turn my face against you, and you will fall before your enemies. You will be ruled by those who hate you, and you will flee even when no one is pursuing you.

verses.latin: Si nec his quoque audieritis me, adjiciam et septies plagas propter peccata vestra:
verses.english: If even after these things you will not listen to me, I will add seven times more plagues upon you for your sins.

verses.latin: et conteram superbiam vestram, et faciam cælum vobis sicut ferrum, et terram æneam.
verses.english: I will break your pride, and I will make the sky above you like iron and the ground beneath you like bronze, yielding nothing.

verses.latin: Frustra ultra labor vestrum fiet, non enim proferet terra germen, nec arbores folia.
verses.english: Your labor will be futile from now on, for the land will not yield its crops, nor will the trees produce their fruit.

verses.latin: Si ambulaveritis contra me, nec volueritis audire me, addam plagas vestras in septuplum juxta peccata vestra:
verses.english: If you continue to walk in hostility toward me and refuse to listen to me, I will increase your plagues sevenfold according to your sins.

verses.latin: emittamque in vos bestias agri, quæ consumant vos et pecora vestra, et in paucitate redigantur universa: desertæque fiant viæ vestræ.
verses.english: I will send wild animals among you, which will devour your children and your livestock and reduce your numbers until your land is desolate, and your roads become deserted.

verses.latin: Si nec sic volueritis erudiri, sed ambulaveritis contra me:
verses.english: If even after this you are unwilling to be corrected, but continue to walk in hostility toward me:

verses.latin: ego quoque contra vos gradior, et percutiam vos septies pro peccatis vestris:
verses.english: then I will also walk in hostility toward you, and I will strike you seven times more for your sins.

verses.latin: inducamque super vos gladium ultorem, qui vindicet fœderis mei injurias: et cum congregati fueritis in urbibus, immittam pestilentiam in medio vestri, et trademini hostibus.
verses.english: I will bring an avenging sword upon you to punish you for breaking my covenant. And when you gather yourselves in your cities for protection, I will send pestilence among you, and you will be delivered to your enemies.

verses.latin: Postquam confregero baculum panis vestri: ita ut deni homines in uno clibanum coquant panem, et reddant eum ad pondus: et comedetis, et non saturabimini.
verses.english: When I break your supply of bread, so that ten men will bake their bread in one oven and will ration it out by weight, you will eat, but you will not be satisfied.

verses.latin: Sin autem nec per hæc audieritis me, sed adversati fueritis mihi:
verses.english: But if, even after all this, you still will not listen to me, but continue to resist me:

verses.latin: ego quoque in ira adversabor vobis, et percutiam vos septem vicibus propter peccata vestra:
verses.english: then I, in turn, will oppose you in wrath, and I will strike you seven times more for your sins.

verses.latin: ita ut comedatis carnes filiorum et filiarum vestrarum.
verses.english: so that you will eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.

verses.latin: Destruam excelsa vestra, et simulacra confringam: cadavera vestra super cadavera idolorum vestrorum projiciam, et abominabitur anima mea vos:
verses.english: I will destroy your high places and break your idol images. I will cast your corpses upon the corpses of your idols, and my soul will detest you.

verses.latin: ita ut civitates vestras redigam in solitudinem, et desertæ fiant sanctuaria vestra, nec odorem suavissimum de aromatibus vestris ultra capiatur a me.
verses.english: I will reduce your cities to ruins and your sanctuaries will be laid waste, and I will no longer accept the sweet aroma of your sacrifices.

verses.latin: Et dissipabo terram vestram, et stupebunt super ea inimici vestri, cum habitatores illius fuerint.
verses.english: I will lay waste your land, and your enemies who settle there will be astonished at its desolation.

verses.latin: Vosque dispergam in gentes, et evaginabo post vos gladium, eritque terra vestra deserta, et civitates dirutæ.
verses.english: And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will pursue you with a drawn sword. Your land will be desolate, and your cities ruined.

verses.latin: Tunc placebit terræ sabbata sua, cunctis diebus solitudinis vestræ: quando fueritis in terra hostili, sabbatizabit, et remunerabitur sabbatis suis:
verses.english: Then the land will enjoy its Sabbaths throughout all the days of your desolation, when you are in an enemy land. It will rest and make up for all the Sabbaths you failed to give it.

verses.latin: quia non quievit in sabbatis vestris, cum in ea habitaretis.
verses.english: because it did not rest on your Sabbaths when you dwelt in it.

verses.latin: Et qui de vobis reliqui fuerint, immittam in corda eorum terrorem in regionibus hostium: terrebit eos sonitus folii volantis, et sic quasi a gladio fugient, cadentque nemine persequente:
verses.english: As for those of you who survive, I will put a dread into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; the sound of a rustling leaf will chase them. They will flee as though from a sword, and they will fall even when no one is pursuing them.

verses.latin: et corruent singuli super fratres suos, quasi bella fugientes, nemine persequente: et non poteritis stare contra hostes vestros.
verses.english: And they will stumble over one another, as if fleeing from battle, even when no one is pursuing them. You will not be able to stand against your enemies.

verses.latin: Peribitis inter gentes, et devorabit vos terra inimica.
verses.english: You will perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies will consume you.

verses.latin: Et si qui reliqui fuerint de vestris, contabescent in iniquitatibus suis in terris alienis: et propter peccata patrum suorum, et sua, corruent.
verses.english: And those of you who are left will waste away because of their sins in the lands of their enemies; they will pine away both for their own sins and for the sins of their fathers.

verses.latin: Donec confiteantur iniquitates suas, et majorum suorum, quibus prævaricati sunt in me, et ambulaverunt contra me.
verses.english: This will continue until they confess their iniquities and the iniquities of their ancestors, by which they transgressed against me and continued in hostility toward me.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord God spoke to Moses, saying to him:

verses.latin: Loquere filiis Israël, et dices ad eos: Homo qui votum fecerit, et voverit animam suam Deo, sub æstimatione vivebit:
verses.english: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them this: If a person makes a vow, dedicating their own life to the Lord God, they must live according to the assigned value of their vow.

verses.latin: Si fuerit masculus a viginti annis usque ad sexaginta, quinquaginta siclis argenti æstimabitur juxta pondus sanctuarii:
verses.english: If the person is a male, from twenty years old up to sixty years old, his assigned value will be fifty shekels of silver, weighed by the standard of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Si femina, triginta.
verses.english: If the person is a female, her assigned value will be thirty shekels.

verses.latin: A quinto autem anno usque ad vigesimum, masculus viginti siclis æstimabitur, femina decem.
verses.english: If the person is from five years old up to twenty years old, a male’s assigned value will be twenty shekels, and a female’s assigned value will be ten shekels.

verses.latin: Ab uno mense usque ad quintum annum pro masculo quinque sicli argenti, pro femina tres æstimabuntur.
verses.english: If the person is from one month old up to five years old, for a male, five shekels of silver will be his assigned value; for a female, three shekels will be her assigned value.

verses.latin: Sexagenarii et ultra, masculus quindecim siclis, femina decem æstimabitur.
verses.english: If the person is sixty years old or older, a male’s assigned value will be fifteen shekels, and a female’s assigned value will be ten shekels.

verses.latin: Si pauper fuerit, et non potuerit supplere æstimationem, stabit coram sacerdote, et quantum ille censuerit, et viderit eum posse reddere, tantum dabit.
verses.english: But if the person is poor and cannot afford the assigned value, he must stand before the priest. The priest will then assess how much the person can afford to pay, and that is what he will give.

verses.latin: Si de animalibus votum fuerit, quæ offerri possunt Domino, quidquid ejus generis intraverit sanctuarium, sanctum erit.
verses.english: If the vow concerns an animal that can be offered to the Lord God, whatever animal of that kind enters the sanctuary will be consecrated.

verses.latin: Non mutabitur, nec variabitur, bonum malo, aut malum bono: si quis autem mutaverit animal, et quod fuerat immutatum, et primum, sanctum erit.
verses.english: The consecrated animal cannot be exchanged or altered, neither a good one for a bad one, nor a bad one for a good one. If anyone tries to exchange an animal, both the exchanged animal and the original animal will become consecrated.

verses.latin: Si omne animal immundum fuerit, quod offerri non potest Domino, stabit ante sacerdotem:
verses.english: If the vow concerns an unclean animal, one that cannot be offered to the Lord God, it must be presented before the priest.

verses.latin: Qui judicans utrum bonum an malum sit, statuet pretium: et sicut ille taxaverit, ita erit.
verses.english: The priest will judge whether the animal is good or bad and will set its value. Whatever value the priest sets, that will be its final price.

verses.latin: Sin autem et redimere illud voluerit qui obtulerat, addet supra æstimationem quintam partem.
verses.english: But if the person who made the vow wishes to buy back the animal, they must add one-fifth to its assigned value.

verses.latin: Si quis voverit domum suam, et sanctificaverit Domino, considerabit eam sacerdos, utrum bona an mala sit, et juxta pretium quod ille posuerit, stabit.
verses.english: If a person makes a vow concerning their house, consecrating it to the Lord God, the priest will inspect it to determine if it is good or bad. Its value will stand according to the price the priest sets.

verses.latin: Sin autem ille qui voverat, voluerit redimere domum suam, addet quintam partem æstimatæ pecuniæ, et habebit eam.
verses.english: But if the person who made the vow wishes to buy back their house, they must add one-fifth of the estimated money, and then they will possess it again.

verses.latin: Si agrum possessionis suæ voverit, et consecraverit Domino, juxta mensuram sementis æstimabitur. Triginta modii hordei, quinquaginta siclis argenti æstimandi sunt:
verses.english: If a person makes a vow concerning their inherited field and consecrates it to the Lord God, its value will be assessed according to the amount of seed required to plant it. A field requiring thirty measures of barley will be valued at fifty shekels of silver.

verses.latin: Si statim ab anno jubilæo voverit agrum, quanti æstimatus fuerit, tanti stabit.
verses.english: If the person dedicates the field immediately after the Year of Jubilee, it will stand at its full assessed value.

verses.latin: Si post paucos annos, computabit sacerdos pecuniam juxta annorum numerum qui restant usque ad jubilæum, et detrahet de pretio.
verses.english: But if the field is dedicated a few years after the Jubilee, the priest will calculate the money according to the number of years remaining until the next Jubilee, and the full price will be reduced by that amount.

verses.latin: Quod si voluerit redimere agrum suum ille qui voverat, addet quintam partem æstimatæ pecuniæ, et possidebit eum.
verses.english: If the person who made the vow wishes to buy back their field, they must add one-fifth of the estimated money, and then they will possess it.

verses.latin: Sin autem noluerit redimere, sed alteri cuilibet vendiderit, ultra non poterit redimi:
verses.english: But if the person does not wish to buy it back and instead sells the field to someone else, it can no longer be redeemed by the original owner.

verses.latin: Quia cum in jubilæo fuerit liberatus, absque aliqua redemptione, sacerdotum erit, sicut possessio consecrata Domino.
verses.english: For when the field is set free in the Jubilee year, without any redemption, it will belong to the priests, as consecrated property belonging to the Lord God.

verses.latin: Si ager emptus fuerit, et non de possessione majorum, sanctificatus fuerit Domino,
verses.english: If a person consecrates to the Lord God a field that they have bought, which is not part of their ancestral inheritance,

verses.latin: Computabit sacerdos juxta annorum numerum usque ad jubilæum, æstimationem pretii: et dabit protinus vovens Domino oblationis pretium.
verses.english: the priest will calculate the value of its price according to the number of years remaining until the Jubilee. The person making the vow must then immediately give the Lord God the value of the offering.

verses.latin: In jubilæo autem revertetur ad priorem dominum, qui vendiderat eum, et habuerat possessionem hæreditatis suæ.
verses.english: In the Jubilee year, however, the field will return to its former owner, who had sold it and owned it as part of his inheritance.

verses.latin: Omnis æstimatio siclo sanctuarii ponderabitur. Siclus habet viginti obolos.
verses.english: All valuations must be weighed by the standard of the sanctuary shekel. One shekel has twenty gerahs—which is the weight of the obol.

verses.latin: Primitiva quoque animalium, quæ sunt Domini, nemo sanctificare poterit, quia sive bos, sive ovis fuerit, Domini sunt.
verses.english: Also, no one can consecrate the firstborn animals, for they already belong to the Lord God. Whether it is an ox or a sheep, they are already the Lord God’s.

verses.latin: Quod si immundum fuerit animal, redimetur juxta æstimationem suam, et addetur quinta pars pretii: si redemptum non fuerit, vendetur alteri juxta æstimationem.
verses.english: But if the firstborn animal is unclean, it must be bought back according to its assigned value, and one-fifth of the price will be added. If it is not bought back, it will be sold to another person according to its assigned value.

verses.latin: Omne quod consecratur Domino ab homine, sive homo, sive animal, sive ager, non vendetur, nec redimi poterit. Quidquid semel fuerit consecratum, sanctum sanctorum erit Domino.
verses.english: Anything that a person dedicates to the Lord God as a thing irrevocably devoted—whether it is a person, an animal, or a field that is their inherited property—it cannot be sold or bought back. Whatever is once irrevocably devoted will be most holy to the Lord God.

verses.latin: Omnis animæ et hominis, quæ consecratur, non redimetur, sed morte morietur.
verses.english: Every human soul and person who is irrevocably devoted will not be bought back, but must be put to death.

verses.latin: Omnes decimæ terræ, sive de frugibus, sive de pomis arborum, Domini sunt, et illi sanctificantur.
verses.english: All tithes of the land, whether from the produce of the soil or from the fruit of the trees, belong to the Lord God and are consecrated to Him.

verses.latin: Si quis voluerit redimere decimas suas, addet quintam partem ejus quod fuerat æstimatum.
verses.english: If anyone wishes to buy back any part of their tithes, they must add one-fifth to its assigned value.

verses.latin: Omnium decimarum boves, et oves, et capræ, quæ sub pastoris virga transeunt, quidquid decimum venerit, sanctificabitur Domino.
verses.english: Regarding all tithes of cattle, sheep, and goats, whatever passes under the shepherd’s staff as the tenth animal will be consecrated to the Lord God.

verses.latin: Non probabitur utrum bonum an malum sit, nec altero commutabitur: si quis commutaverit, et quod mutatum est, et ipsum quod primum fuerat, sanctum erit, et ad possessorem non revertetur.
verses.english: The tenth animal will not be examined to see if it is good or bad, nor can it be exchanged for another. If anyone exchanges it, both the exchanged animal and the original animal will become consecrated, and neither will return to the original owner.”

verses.latin: Hæc sunt præcepta quæ mandavit Dominus Moysi ad filios Israël in monte Sinai.
verses.english: These are the commandments that the Lord God gave to Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
